It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation and she is satisfied with the support from it. Currently she applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shehnaz is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has gained one year of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stock of grains, biscuits and packs of cleaning products such as soaps and detergents. It would help her to cater to more customers time after time without fail. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of grains, biscuits and packs of cleaning products such as soaps and detergents

loans.name: Simuzar

texts.en:
Simuzar is 43 years old, married, and has three children: 19-year-old and 16-year-old sons and a 6-year-old daughter. Her daughter and sons go to school. She wants her daughter to become a painting instructor. Simuzar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now she lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with her husband and children. She started her business selling bedding (bedsheets, coverlets, towels etc.) 1 year ago.

Now Simuzar needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy stock. She wants to use the money from her expanded business to help her family. In the future, Simuzar wants to expand the area of her shop. This will be more profitable for her business. She is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy bedsheets, coverlets, towels etc.

loans.name: Asiimwe

texts.en:
Asiimwe is aged 50 years old. He is married with five children, aged 26, 24, 22, 20 and 18 years, respectively. Three of the children attend school, and he is the one in charge of paying their tuition.

He is a farmer involved in the growing of tobacco, a business he has been doing since 1983 as a major income-generating source for the family. He also grows maize, bananas and coffee, but on a small scale as an additional source of income.

Asiimwe wants a loan of 1,100,000 shillings to pay school fees for his children; two are at technical institutes and one is in secondary school. The harvest time is still a moth away, which is the reason he is applying for the loan.

His dream is to see the children complete their education and maybe look after him when he can no longer work.

Asiimwe is always challenged by the seasonality of agricultural production and the price fluctuations on the market.

loans.use: To pay tuition for three of his children.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 67 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene seis hijos. Desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a trabajar junto a sus padres y hermanos en la agricultura y en los cafetales peinando café. A los 18 años de edad se acompaño y empezó a ayudar a su compañero de vida en trabajos agrícolas y en los cafetales junto a sus hijos.  Los insumos agrícolas los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a 6 kilómetros de su casa; viaja en autobús con los insumos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pollos de engorde y concentrado para los mismos. Con el préstamo empezara a instalar la granja de polos de engorde y así mejorara la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Su propósito, es continuar trabajando muy fuerte para ampliar la granja.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old, in a relationship, and has six children. At a very young age, she decided to begin farming with her parents and siblings, as well as work in the coffee plantations. Rosa entered into a relationship at the age of 18 and began helping her partner with the farm work. She later worked in the coffee fields with her children. Rosa acquires her farming supplies in a city that is located six kilometers from her house. She must travel by bus to obtain these supplies.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy chickens for fattening and concentrated feed. The loan will enable her to start a poultry farm so that she can improve her children’s quality of life. Her plans include continuing to work hard so that she can expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening and concentrated poultry feed.

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Batdorj, 26 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently, his family is residing in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has a position of driver at a private business entity. His wife has been working at a pharmacy since 2005 as prescription writer. 

The house they previously lived in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repair, so he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Kongolian tugriks) to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, he can repair and insulate his house completely and make it back to its original state. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and then contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 51 years old. She lives in the small village of Baghdati District with her husband, three children and a daughter-in-law. Tina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business startup, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Tina’s son works as a local artisan and gets a small monthly income. Besides that, they are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig, three milking cows and a vineyard. They sell the harvested grapes and dairy products at local markets. It is hardly enough on food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tina requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Tina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Tina will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, she will be able to sow vegetables and sell the harvested vegetables. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and sow vegetables.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Ms. Nusrat is a 48-year-old married lady. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Nusrat makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, Nusrat requested a loan of Rs 50,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her sixth loan cycle and wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
In 2011, Michelle left her hometown of Miami when the opportunity to acquire a franchise of Healthy Living magazine in Austin presented itself. Her chance to pursue her dream of improving the physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual essence of readers was just a plane ride away.

As a devoted Healthy Living magazine reader for the past ten years, Michelle understood the importance of health and wellness. After purchasing the franchise publication, she soon discovered the magazine franchise wasn’t doing too well, but her drive and persistence kept her moving forward.

After hearing of Accion Texas Inc., Michelle applied and was approved for a loan she is using to focus on expanding the publication’s distribution, page count, and sales team. She has seen an increase in sales and is ready for the growth of the business.  

“It may be a long path, but it is worth it,” Michelle said. “What I did was a leap of faith. I lived in Miami my whole life, but I wanted to do something that made a difference. I moved myself a thousand miles to a town I did not know and took over a franchise magazine. My motto is do one thing every day that scares you. The journey may not be easy, but it will give you more strength and courage.”

loans.use: to expand the publication’s distribution, page count, and sales team.

loans.name: Ervin

texts.en:
Ervin started his own janitorial company, ENJ Enterprise, as a side business 10 years ago.  He prides himself in doing top quality work for his customers at a competitive price.  Although he still has a full-time job, Ervin is looking to increase his business’s customer base so that he can be one step closer to financial independence.

Ervin was recently awarded a new contract with Fort Sam Houston in San Antonio.  While thrilled at the new business opportunity, he was concerned about the large financial strain his business would experience during the first month of taking on the new contract.  As he explored his options to resolve this concern, Ervin came across the Accion Texas Inc. website and applied for a loan.

With the funds he receives from the loan, Ervin will be able to cover payroll expenses for his employees until he receives the first payment from his new customer.  This is an important and large contract that Ervin would not have been able to take on without a boost to his working capital.  He is hopeful that this will help propel his company to the next level as he works toward his ultimate goal of full-time business operations.

loans.use: to cover payroll expenses

loans.name: La Cabañita Group

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 41 años de edad, ella pertenece a un grupo llamado La Cabañita y dice que una prima fue que la invito a formar parte del grupo el cual trabaja con Visión Fund pidiendo créditos para mejorar su negocio y con las ganancias mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Ella es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, Ale como de cariño le dicen se dedica a la venta de colchas, zapatos, ropa para dama y caballero por catalogo, dice que emprendió este trabajo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que tiene 4 hijos y no podía salir a trabajar fueras ya que con ella vive su abuelita a la cual cuida porque está enferma y tiene que estar al pendiente de ella, dice que por eso decidió poner su propio negocio para estar más al pendiente de su casa, ella por la mañanas prepara a sus hijos para ir a la escuela y después hace el desayuno para su abuelita y para ella ya  que su esposo sale a muy temprana hora a trabajar, hace su aseo y se va a vender de casa en casa su ropa, colchas que vende y hay veces que ya sus clientas la van a buscar hasta su casa para encargarle algo. Dice que sus artículos que vende los surte en tiendas autorizadas en la población de Zitacuaro para que le den mejores precios. Ahorita ella está pidiendo el crédito para surtir algunos pedidos que tiene pendiente por parte de sus clientas, comenta que en este mes es cuando tiene más ventas ya que hay varios festejos del día de la madre, del día del maestro, el día del estudiante, las clausuras de las escuelas y la gente aprovecha para hacer regalos y van a ella y le compran zapatos o ropa, es por eso que ahorita ella quiere tener muy bien surtido. Alejandra agradece a VisionFund por la confianza que le han tenido y hacerle créditos para mejorar su negocio y así poder apoyar a su esposo, a sus hijos y a su abuelita. Las demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Consuelo, Florentina, Esperanza, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Liliana, Reynalda y Sofía ellas invertirán en sus negocios de taller de serigrafía, en la compra de artículos para tienda de abarrotes, en la compra de insumos para elaborar antojitos mexicanos, para la compra de insumos para elaborar pan, para la compra de material para elaborar joyería fina y bisutería, en la compra de refacciones para arreglo de vehículos, para la compra de alimento para gallinas para engorda y después venderlas.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 41, belongs to a group called “La Cabañita” (The Little Cottage) and says that her cousin invited her to join the group that works with Visión Fund asking for loans to improve their businesses aiming at improving their families’ quality of life.  She’s a very hardworking, cheerful woman.  

Ale, as she’s affectionately called, sells bedspreads, shoes and clothes for women and men by catalog.  She says she started this business to help her husband with household expenses since she has four children and was unable to work outside the home because her grandmother also lives with her and she’s not well and she must take care of her.  She says that’s why she decided to start her own business so she could stay and care for her home.  

She gets her children ready for school in the morning and then makes breakfast for her grandmother and for her since her husband leaves for work very early in the morning.  She does her cleaning chores and then heads out to sell bedspreads house to house; sometimes her customers come to her house looking for her to order something or other.  

She says that she gets the things she sells from authorized suppliers in the city of Zitácuaro so she can get better prices.  At the moment, she’s asking for a loan to fill some pending customer orders.  She comments that this is the month when sales are highest because of Mother’s Day, Teacher’s Day, Student’s Day and the end of the school term; people take advantage of this to give gifts and they come to her to buy shoes and clothes.  This is why she wants to be well-stocked right now.  Alejandra thanks VisionFund for the trust they’ve placed in her and for giving her loans to improve her business thus helping her husband, children and grandmother.  

The other group members are named Consuelo, Florentina, Esperanza, Tomasa, Blanca Estela, Maricela, Martha, Liliana, Reynalda and Sofía.  They will invest in their businesses which are: silkscreen shop, grocery store, Mexican fast-food snacks, bread baking, fine and costume jewelry making, vehicle repair shop and feed for fattening up chickens for subsequent sale.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, shoes and clothes by catalog.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ms. Ishrat is a 41-year-old widow; she has been doing a business of selling vegetables for the past two years. She is very enthusiastic in her business of selling vegetables and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of three daughters and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement of her business, Ishrat contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase sacks of vegetables such as onions, potatoes and ginger. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. 

Ishrat dreams to provide a quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables such as onions, potatoes and ginger.

loans.name: Roselina

texts.es:
Roselina es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y joven de 23 años casada con un grado de educación de primaria completado cursado hasta el 6 grado por lo cual agradase el esfuerzo a sus padres por el apoyo brindado. Junto a su esposo tienen 2 hijos de los cuales el mayor está en el kínder y el último de 2 años. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron la elaboración de viveros y a cultivar café desde muy pequeña ya que ha sido y será medio de ingreso para su familia y hoy en día en su hogar. Su único apoyo es su esposo el cual se encarga de los negocios y de la distribución siendo ella la administradora. Ella también tiene un vivero de café el cual lo está empezando a preparar para su cultivo y otra parte para la venta. Su producto es comercializado con los intermediarios que llegan a la zona y que la caracterizan su producto como un producto de calidad e higiénico.
 
Hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas para poder darle mantenimiento al cultivo de café y poder fortalecer su vivero que hoy en día tiene en proceso de crecimiento.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación y mantener sanas sus cosechas ya que es el único medio de ingreso para su familia y poder cubrir los estudios de sus hijos como hasta hoy en día.
texts.en:
Roselina is a young, resourceful and tenacious woman aged 23. She is married, and she has studied up to the 6th grade of primary school, thanks to the sacrificed made by her parents, to whom she deeply grateful. She and her husband have two children: the eldest attends kindergarten and the youngest is 2. Her parents have taught her how to make a plant nursery and grow coffee when she was very young, and this has been and will be her family’s source of income as well as her household’s. She can count on her husband’s support only: he takes care of the chores and coordinates the distribution process, while she manages the activity. She also owns a coffee vivarium, and she preparing part of it to be sowed and part of it to be sold. She sells her products to wholesalers coming to her community, who consider her products as hygienic and of good quality.
She is currently requesting help to buy fertilizers, manure and pest-control substances in order to provide maintenance to her coffee crops and to reinforce her vivarium, as it is still flourishing.
Her plans for the future include owing a vast coffee plantation that will keep on being profitable, thus providing an income for her family; she hopes her plantation can be handed down and used for generations; she also aims at keeping her crops healthy, as this is the only source of income for her family, as in this way she will be able to continue paying for her children’s education as she has done to today.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure and pest-control substances.

loans.name: Oshin

texts.es: Oshin, de 21 años,es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos, su madre y sus dos  sobrinos.Oshin se dedica a la venta de diversos cosméticos como perfumes, colonias aromáticas, cremas corporales, lociones, lápices para labios, rimel y otros accesorios femeninos como aretes y collares. Realiza las ventas por catálogos de diversas marcas que prefiere el público femenino. Toda su mercadería es enviada la fecha programada en grandes paquetes desde otra ciudad. A diario va en busca de clientes por las calles de su barrio y vende al contado o a crédito. Realiza este oficio hace 4 años. Trabaja sola y se siente muy satisfecha por lo bien que le va hasta ahora.Le gusta mucho tener este trabajo porque le permite disponer de su tiempo durante las horas que no está trabajando ya que puede realizar las labores de su hogar con mucha comodidad, además a aprendido a ganarse el respeto y la confianza de los clientes en base a su buen trato y su gran sonrisa. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 400 soles y está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con su negocio.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería conformada por perfumes, cremas, aretes, collares y otros accesorios para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Oshin is 21 years old, single, and lives at her parents’ house with her siblings, her mother, and two nephews. She decided to sell a variety of cosmetics such as perfumes, aromatic colognes, body crèmes, lotions, lip pencils, Rimmel mascara, as well as women’s accessories such as earrings and necklaces. All of her merchandise is shipped from another city in large boxes on a scheduled date. She travels through the streets of her neighborhood in search of customers and then sells her products for cash or on credit. Oshin has been in this line of work for four years. She works alone and is very pleased that she has been successful to this point. Oshin enjoys her work very much because it allows her the free time to take care of the household chores without feeling rushed. In addition, she has learned to gain the respect and trust of her customers by treating them well and offering them a huge smile.

Oshin is taking this opportunity to request 400 PEN. She is grateful and pleased to know that she continues to have the financial support she needs to advance her business. The amount she requested will be used to buy merchandise such as perfumes, crèmes, earrings, necklaces, and other accessories so that she can continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, earrings, necklaces, and other accessories.

loans.name: Wilmer Kevin

texts.es:
Wilmer es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Wlimer se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana, el está cursando el segundo ciclo de su carrera y es un buen estudiando, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Wilmer trabaja como camarero en un restaurante de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su rapidez y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Wilmer se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de su uniforme de laboratorio e implementos como un estetoscopio, guantes, jeringas y otros, de esta manera Wilmer podrá contar con los materiales necesarios para cursar adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran doctor.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a 21-year-old man. He is single and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and brothers. He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person and has a great desire to succeed. Thanks to his hard work and the support of his parents, Wilmer is studying medicine. He is in the second phase of his studies. He is a good student. In his free time, he likes to watch movies. From time to time, he cooks a delicious lomo saltado [strips of marinated sirloin and stirfried with vegetables] to share with his family.
Wilmer decided on his own to work as a waiter in a restaurant in the city. He works with great dedication and determination. He works every day for about eight hours and says that it is going well for him because he is fast and treats people well.
Wilmer is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to your help he will be able to buy his lab coat and supplies such as a stethoscope, gloves, and syringes. This way, Wilmer will have the necessary supplies for passing his studies. He will continue to work hard in order to achieve his dream of being a great doctor.

loans.use: to buy a lab coat and medical supplies.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José tiene 62 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene una hija. Desde la edad de los 16 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura; actividad que aprendió de sus abuelos. Antes solo se dedicaba a estudiar. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas debe desplazarse aproximadamente a dos horas de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, semilla de maicillo y maíz, pago de alquiler de la tierra y pago de mano de obra para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados. Al cultivar maíz, asegurara el alimento para su familia y con la siembra del maicillo alimentara sus vacas para que produzcan leche y se engorden para venderlas. Su sueño es brindarle el estudio a su hija para que sea una profesional.
texts.en:
José, 62, is in a relationship and has a daughter. He has worked in agriculture since he was 16, which he learned from his grandparents. Before that he studied. 

He needs to travel approximately two hours from his house to buy agricultural supplies. 

The loan from Fundación Campo will buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, sorghum and corn seed, it will pay for the rent of the land and pay for the labor to cultivate the 7,000 square meters. 

By cultivating corn he ensures there will be food for his family. He will feed his cows the sorghum to produce milk and fatten them up to sell them. 

His dream is to give his daughter an education to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, sorghum and corn seed, it will pay for the rent of the land and pay for the labor to cultivate the 7,000 square meters.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Ms. Saeeda is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Saeeda’s husband. They have gained 25 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

Saeeda is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Manzoora

texts.en: Ms. Manzoora is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. For the past 20 years, she has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales and income increased. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 in order to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her second loan cycle with Kiva partner Kashf Foundation and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tienen 3 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Victoria, Yoro. Miguel siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, de maíz y frijoles y  lleva 7 años de dedicarse a cultivar café. Tiene su propia finca de café y la producción la vende en grano húmedo en el mercado local de la comunidad. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y limpiar el cultivo. Su objetivo es mantener su finca en buenas condiciones para sacar buenas cosechas y de las ganancias piensa comprar más terreno para ampliar la siembra. También quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y lograr un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en: Miguel, age 37, lives with his partner. They have three children and live in a small town in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro. Miguel has always worked in agriculture, sowing corn and beans, and he started cultivating coffee seven years ago. He has his own coffee farm and sells his product in wet grain form at a local community market. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 lempiras for the purchase of fertilizer and manure, and to clean up the land. His goal is to keep his farm in good condition in order to obtain a good harvest. With his earnings, he plans to buy more land to expand his production. He also wants his children to finish studying and obtain a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, and to pay labourers to clean up the land.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en: Ms. Shama is a 23-year-old lady and she has been in the business of making footballs for many years. Her father passed away 10 years ago so her mother started a business of stitching footballs. Shama joined her mother’s business and is now well known in her community for providing best quality footballs in different sizes. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of Rs. 25,000. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities in order to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to increase her sales which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Ms. Kishwar is a 25 year-old married woman and the mother of two sons. She started stitching work considering she can manage the circle of home well and can better take care of her sons. Her husband is employed with a low salary income that is insufficient to meet the needs of the family members. So three years ago Kishwar began stitching work in her house to contribute to the family income. Kishwar is an expert in stitching trousers and has made her mark with it. She purchases open cloth from the market and then makes trousers and sells them to the people of her vicinity. 

It’s her third year with Kiva partner Kashf Foundation.  She is currently requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000 in order to buy cloth, thread and zippers in large quantities. She expects to boost her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and zippers in large quantities.

loans.name: Zikria

texts.en:
Ms. Zikria is a 53-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Her husband is also a tailor by profession. Zikria accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household with the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 in order to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors.

loans.name: La Providence De Dilaire Group

texts.fr:
Miliane est la coordinatrice de son groupe La Providence de Dilaire. Elle habite dans la région de Dilaire dans Trou-du-Nord d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de vente de produits divers pendant les 8 dernières années. Elle est marie et elle a 5 enfants.

Miliane voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans la vetement, chaussures, cosmetiques, etc. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits divers comme cosmétiques, vêtements, chaussures et du charbon. Miliane espère qu'avec ce prêt peut faire croître votre entreprise.
texts.en:
Miliane is the coordinator of her group La Providence de Dilaire. She lives in the Dilaire region, in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Miliane would like to use this loan to invest in clothing, shoes, cosmetics, etc. to sell.  Other members of the group have need of a loan for businesses that sell such products as cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and charcoal. Miliane hopes that this loan will make her enterprise grow.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Zoia

texts.en:
Zoia is 56 years-old. She lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi with her 30 year-old daughter. Zoia has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests have been rejected due to low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Zoia owns a bakery. She is baking pastries and her daughter is selling them. The family is working very hard to get a small monthly income. 

Zoia requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Zoia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Zoia will renovate her bakery and purchase an additional cooker. She will be able to bake a great variety of pastries to offer better choice to her clients. This will significantly increase the numbers of sales and Zoia will be able to expand her business more.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate her bakery and purchase an additional cooker.

loans.name: Adjeley's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six partners residing in Teshie. They are Adjeley, Gifty, Comfort S, Comfort O, Jemimah, and Merley. They have been together since 2010 and are still doing very well. They sell cosmetics, stools, brooms, fish, slippers and maize respectively.

Adjeley, the leader, is 51 years old and sells cosmetics, stools, and brooms. She is a widow and has two grown children who are on their own. She has been in business for the past five years. On November 27th, 2010, she took her first loan of GHS 100. Through her dedication and seriousness in her business, she has been able to build up trust with ID Ghana. 

For her 6th loan, she is requesting an amount of GHS 500 to help her boost the business and to satisfy her customers in and around the community.

The members together need GHS 2,550 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, stools, and brooms to sell to customers

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 50 years old and lives in Baghdati district with his wife, Irina, two sons and a daughter. Zaza requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Zaza’s oldest son is working in the Ministry of Internal Affairs on a small monthly salary (400 GEL), which is the only source of living for the family. 

Zaza requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Zaza will purchase all the needed equipment and furniture to open a restaurant. He has a building which is under construction now. Zaza is working very hard to make the restaurant look nice and have good food there to satisfy the clients. The restaurant is located in a very beautiful area, and Zaza hopes this will help him to attract a lot of people.  

Zaza and his family members will work in the restaurant themselves and try to make the business successful. It will increase the family income, and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase all the needed equipment and furniture to open a restaurant.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada con Cirilo con quien tiene 4 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia.Felicitas posee una fábrica artesanal en donde elabora ladrillos rojos, los cuales son muy utilizados en su localidad , anteriormente se dedicaba a sembrar cacao orgánico pero gracias a los beneficios que obtiene de su fabrica ha decidio dedicarse únicamente a esta actividad.
Nunca pensó en dedicarse a la elaboración de ladrillos puesto que sus padres y abuelos se dedicaron netamente a la agricultura, es por ello que trabaja con la motivación de brindarle a sus hijos menores una buena educación para ser personas útiles en la sociedad.Uno de sus objetivos a largo plazo es la compra de un vehículo para transportar ladrillos a los distintos puntos de su localidad y disminuir sus gastos.Este es el cuarto crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero que le brindad para seguir adelante.Desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar leña y pagar a sus trabajadores.
texts.en:
Felicitas, age 34, is married to Cirilo.  They have four children, and they live together in their own house.  Felicitas has a business making artisanal red bricks, which are used a lot in her area.  She used to grow organic cacao, but thanks to the benefits she gets from her factory, she has decided to devote herself only to this business activity.

She never thought that she would make bricks given that her parents and grandparents worked purely in agriculture.  Her motivation for work is to give her minor children a good education so that they will become useful people in society.

One of her long term objectives is to buy a vehicle to transport the bricks to different spots in her area and to decrease her expenses.

This is her fourth loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support given to her so that she can get ahead.  She wants 2,000 soles to buy firewood and to pay the workers.

loans.use: to buy firewood and to pay the workers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es una persona   muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y su hijos de 1 año, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la  comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. El cliente solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y también para mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía que es donde siembra sus cultivos, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: This client is a very kind and hardworking person.  He lives with his wife and his one-year-old children.  He works very hard on his own plot of land where he grows corn and beans.  His produce is very high quality and when his harvest is ready he sells to different markets close to where he lives.  He is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to have the money he needs to invest in farming supplies, such as pest control, fertilizers, and seed, among other things he needs for his crops.  He will also improve the land he grows on, which is pictured above.  He hopes to increase his sales so he will see better earnings and offer his family financial stability.

loans.use: to buy pest control, fertilizers, seed, etc.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 33 años,está casada con Custodio y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.Tiene una fábrica artesanal en donde elabora ladrillos para construcción de viviendas y construcciones similares.Anteriormente vivía en la capital de su región y su esposo la convenció de continuar con el negocio de sus padres en su localidad.Para la elaboración de ladrillos necesita arena adecuada el cual trae con ayuda de camiones desde una cantera local para posteriormente con ayuda de jornaleros amoldar los bloques y hornearlos obteniendo así ladrillos listos para ser usados.Se inicio desde hace 6 años y desde que empezó tiene buenas ventas porque en su localidad se construyen más viviendas .Este es el segundo préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo.
Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar arena y leña para así elaborar los ladrillos que pone a la venta .
texts.en:
Lucila, age 33, is married to Custodio.  They have three children with whom they live in their own house.  She has an artisan factory making bricks for building houses and similar constructions.

She used to live in the capital of her region, and her husband convinced her to continue his parents’ business in his area.  She needs suitable sand to make the bricks.  She gets it with the help of trucks from a local quarry.  Later, with the help of workers, they shape the blocks and bake them.  This way they get bricks that are ready to be used.  She started six years ago.  She has had good sales since she began because more houses are being built in her area.

This is her second loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the financial support she is getting so that she can continue with her work.

She wishes to have 1,000 soles to buy sand and firewood to make the bricks that she sells.

loans.use: to buy sand and firewood to make bricks.

loans.name: Paulino Alfonso

texts.es:
Paulino tiene 58 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca la cual se caracteriza por su clima muy cálido y por poseer lugares turísticos muy hermosos como las líneas de nazca, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial los cultivos de tuna, maíz, algodón, entre otros. Paulino vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene 4 maravillosos hijos y por los cuales son ha luchado cada día para  brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y sean personas de bien.
Cada día y a tempranas horas Paulino trabaja como agricultor , el ha sembrado actualmente maíz morado, el cual es usado para la elaboración de la riquísima Chicha Morada y la mazamorra, Paulino trabaja en su parcela alrededor de 8 horas al dia ya que es muy cuidadoso con su cultivo y sobre todo porque le gusta lo que hace.

Paulino está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, arar la tierra y poder mejorar su cultivo, lo que le permitirá tener una buena cosecha y mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera el podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder viajar a Brazil para poder ver a su menor hija, la cual no ve hace varios años”.
texts.en:
Paulino is 58 years old. He lives in the city of Nazca. It is characterized by its warm climate and for having beautiful tourist attractions such as the Nazca lines. There is also agriculture, especially prickly pears, corn, cotton and more. Paulino lives with his wife, with whom he has 4 wonderful children, for whom he fights every day to offer them a better quality of life and for them to be good people.

Every day in the early morning hours, Paulino works as a farmer. Right now he is growing blue corn, which is used to prepare the delicious Chicha Morada and mazamorra. Paulino works on his land parcel for around 8 hours a day because he is very careful with his crop and above all, he likes what he does.

Paulino is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy manure, fertilizer, till the land and improve his crop. This will allow him to have a good harvest and improve his income. in this way, he will keep fighting to make his biggest dream come true: be able to travel to Brazil to see his youngest daughter, whom he hasn't seen for several years.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and more.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino tiene  33 años de edad, esta casado con Carmen con quien tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años respectivamente. Vive junto a su familia en una casa construida a base de adobe.Se dedica a la producción de  distintos productos rentables de la zona como cacao, café entre otros.Posee un terreno agrícola de 2 hectáreas donde trabaja con ayuda de su esposa Carmen y trabajadores del lugar con el objetivo de obtener una buena calidad de frutos al terminar la campaña.Hace 14 años que se inicio en esta labor y desde entonces usa abono orgánico para mejorar la calidad de sus productos.Uno de sus planes a futuro es comprar un vehiculo y facilitar el transporte de los sacos con café hasta los centros de venta de la ciudad porque los transportistas suelen cobrar precios muy altos por el servicio de traslado.Este es el segundo préstamo con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero brindado para seguir con su negocio.En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizar sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Marcelino, age 33, is married to Carmen.  They have two children, ages eight and ten.  They live with their family in an adobe house.  He produces different products that are profitable in the area.  

He produces cacao and coffee, among others.  He has two hectares of agricultural land.  He works there with help from his wife, Carmen, and the workers in the area.  He works with the objective of getting a good quality yield when the season ends.

He started this work 14 years ago.  Since then he has been using organic compost in order to improve the quality of his products.

One of his plans for the future is to buy a vehicle to facilitate transporting the sacks of coffee to the sales centers in the city.  He wants to do this because the transporters generally charge very high prices for the transportation service.

This is his second loan with Kiva.  He is grateful for the financial support provided so that he can continue with his business.  This time he wishes to have 2,000 soles to buy sacks of organic compost and to fertilize his coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Sandy Roxana

texts.es:
Sandy es una joven de 24 años, es madre de un pequeño de 4 años de edad a quien quiere muchísimo y por el cual cada día Sandy trabaja muy duro para poder darle lo necesario para su crecimiento, ella saca adelante a su pequeño sola ya que el padre de su pequeño la abandono y desde ese momento es madre y padre para su hijo y afronta las dificultades con mucha valentía y mucho amor de madre.

Día a día Sandy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de alquiler de ropa, ella trabaja a las afueras de un reclusorio ubicado a las afueras de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo.

Sandy está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder construir una cocina en su vivienda ya que actualmente es de adobe, de esta manera Sandy podrá ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y evitar futuros accidentes ya que las estructuras están resquebrajadas, así Sandy seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder mejorar su negocio y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Sandy is a 24 year old young woman. She is the mother of a four year old whom she loves very much and for whom Sandy works very hard every day to give him every thing he needs to grow. She gets her little one ahead alone, since his father abandoned him and since then she has been both mother and father for her son and she faces the difficulties with much bravery and mother's love. 

Day to day, Sandy works in her little business renting clothes. She works outside a prison on the outskirts of town and with the fruit of her labors she can pay for her household expenses with a lot of hard work. 

Sandy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help, she will be able to buy construction materials and build a kitchen in her house, since right now it is made of adobe. In this way, Sandy will be able to offer her son a better quality of life and avoid future accidents, since the structures are  cracking. Sandy will keep fighting to be able to make her biggest dream come true: be able to improve her business and giver her son a good education.

loans.use: to build a kitchen out of brick.

loans.name: Chroeurn

texts.en:
Chroeurn (pictured here), age 22, is single and lives with his parents and brother and sister in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His parents are rice farmer; his brother is a fisherman and his sister is garment worker. 

Chroeurn is now in his first semester, first year at his Agriculture University in Phnom Penh. He will soon go to his second semester, first year. 

Hence, he requests a loan in the amount of $200 to pay for his second semester and first year of his university.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial  tiene 38 años de edad ,esta casado y vive en una casa de material noble el cual es fruto de muchos años de trabajo. Es agricultor hace 16 años y se dedica a cultivar diversos productos de la zona como cacao, café y otros.Aprendió el oficio de la agricultura gracias a sus padres porque creció en el campo junto a sus hermanos con quienes apoyaba en tareas menores.Cuando cumplió 18 años de edad sus padres le cedieron un pequeño terreno agrícola para empezar a ganar dinero por si mismo y desde entonces ha comprado terrenos aledaños.En toda su parcela posee más plantaciones de cacao porque es uno de los productos más rentables de su zona. Para limpiar la maleza de sus cultivos contrata a trabajadores del lugar para realizar una limpieza uniforme del área total de sus plantaciones.Usa abono orgánico para mejorar la calidad de sus productos esperando recuperar el dinero que invierte en cada campaña con la venta de los granos secos a los compradores del lugar. 
Desea seguir trabajando con la motivación que lo caracteriza y comprar con el tiempo otra parcela para seguir cultivando otros productos a fin de mejorar sus ingresos económicos.Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará un pequeño terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Marcial  is 38 years old. He is married and lives in a brick house, the fruit of many years of labor. He has been a farmer for 16 years and he grows different  products from the area, such as cacao and coffee and more, He learned the trade of farming thanks to his parents, because he grew up in the country with his siblings, who helped with the smaller tasks. When he turned 18, his parents transferred to him a small plot of farmland to start earning money for himself. Since then, he has bought surrounding plots. On his whole parcel he has more cacao plants because it is one of the products that is the most profitable in the area.To clear the weeds from his crops, he hires workers from the area to clear it uniformly in all the crops. He uses organic fertilizer to improve the quality of his products, hoping to earn back the money he invests in each campaign by selling the dried beans to the area buyers. 
 
He wants to keep working with his typical motivation and in time buy another parcel to keep growing other products to improve his income. With the 1,000 nuevos soles, he will buy a small plat of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is a 59 year old fisherman and seaweed farmer from the town of CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of two grown up children. Arturo has been in the business for more than 10 years now.
Arturo is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw and others. Through this, he will be able to improve his seaweed farming and harvest. In the future, Arturo hopes of expanding his venture and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw and others

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is a farmer from the town of Alicia, Bohol. She is married and has three young children. Christy has been in the farming business for more than 8 years now. She helps her husband in tilling their land.
Christy wants to expand and improve their farm but lacks the capital to do so. With this, she asks for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, Christy will be able to grow a healthy crops and improve their harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: German Domingo

texts.es:
German tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de Tuna, frejol, algodón, entre otros, asimismo hay atractivos turísticos como las “líneas de Nazca”, las cuales reciben a muchos turistas en cualquier época del año. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho caminar y en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo chicharrón de cerdo. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Medicina Humana.

Día a día German trabaja muy duro como agricultor, el ha sembrado tuna para el cultivo de cochinilla, el trabaja alrededor de 7 horas diarias ya que siempre esta al pendiente de que su cultivo este en buenas condiciones; él cree que el va bien porque es responsable y dedicado a lo que hace.

German está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva  ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su valioso apoyo, con el cual  podrá realizar la infestación de mas cochinilla en su cultivo y poder sembrar más tuna; así de esta manera podrá tener mejores ingresos y tener una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá seguir esforzándose y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Instalar una botica y una ferretería en su vivienda”.
texts.en: German is 45 years old and lives in the city of Nazca, which is known for having a cool climate and most of all for its agriculture, especially crops like beans and cotton. There are also tourist attractions like "líneas de Nazca", which has visitors throughout the year. When he has free time, German enjoys to go on walks and eat his one of his favorite meals, delicious pork rinds. Because of his limited economic resources, he was only able to complete the fifth grade, but he would have liked to have studied medicine. German works very hard day to day as a farmer. He has grown cacti to attract cochineal (insects from which the crimson-colored dye carmine is derived), and works around seven hours a day because he is always making sure that his crop is in good condition. He believes his work is going well because he is responsible and dedicated to what he does. German is very grateful for Kiva lenders because this is the second time you have provided your valuable support. With the loan, he plans to grow the cochineal infestation so he can produce more dye and in this way he can increase his income and have a good harvest. This will allow him to keep working hard and fighting so he can realize his biggest dream: installing a pharmacy and a hardware store in his home.

loans.use: to attract more cochineal and purchase manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед 29-летний молодой человек. Он женат и живет со своей семьей в городе Вахдат. Хуршед имеет высшее экономическое образование, однако по специальности он не работал. Сейчас Хуршед планирует открыть бильярдную в своем городе. У него имеется опыт работы в этой сфере. Хуршед уже приобрел помещение для бильярдного клуба. Теперь он нуждается в кредите, чтобы провести там ремонт и закупить бильярдный стол и другие необходимые бильярдные принадлежности. Хуршед очень надеется на Вашу поддержку и верит в успешность своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Khurshed, aged 29,  is a young married man who lives with his family in the city of Vahdat.  He has a college education and studied economics, but he has not worked in his field of study.

Khurshed would like to open a billiard club in his city.  He has experience in this field and he has already acquired the premises to open such a club.  He currently needs a loan to repair these premises and to buy a pool table as well as other necessary accessories.

Khurshed looks very forward to your support and believes in the success of his business.

loans.use: to buy a pool table and to renovate some premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Cresnado

texts.en: Cresnado is a 35 year old fisherman from the town of CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and has two young children. Cresnado has been in the fishing business for more than 5 years now. This is the source of his income. Cresnado is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. With this, he will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. Cresnado hopes of saving money for future schooling of his children and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Adriel

texts.es:
Adriel tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de Tuna, frejol, algodón, entre otros, asimismo hay atractivos turísticos como las “líneas de Nazca”, las cuales reciben a muchos turistas en cualquier época del año. Adriel es padre de 2 pequeños y al lado de su esposa lucha cada dia para poder darle lo mejor y poder brindarles una vida digna. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos no pudo terminar la secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Adriel trabaja muy duro como agricultor,  el trabaja alrededor de 7 horas diarias ya que siempre está al pendiente de que su cultivo y sobre todo ahora que esta en la etapa de siembra esta mas al pendiente de que las semillas germinen y este en buenas condiciones; él cree que el va bien porque es responsable y dedicado a lo que hace.

Adirel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva  ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su valioso apoyo, podrá comprar abono, vitaminas, fertilizantes y poder solventar los gastos de riego; así de esta manera podrá tener mejores ingresos y tener una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá seguir esforzándose y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Adriel, 33, lives in the city of Nazca. A city characterized by its warm weather and above all for its agricultural development, especially cultivating prickly pear, beans, cotton etc. 

Also there are tourist attractions such as "The Nazca Lines" which attract a lot of tourist year round. 

Adriel is the father of two little ones and he and his wife strive every day to give them the best and to provide them with a good life. 

Due to his poor economic resources he was not able to finish high school but he would've liked to have studies at the university. 

Day to day Adriel works very hard as a farmer, he works about seven hours a day and is always aware of his harvest especially now during the height of the sowing season, ensuring that the seeds germinate and are in good condition. 

He believes things are going well for him because he is responsible and is dedicated to his job. 

Adriel is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. This is the second time that they give their valuable support. He will be able to buy fertilizer, vitamins and cover the costs of irrigation. 

This way he can have a better income and a good harvest which will allow him to keep striving and fighting for his biggest dream "having your own home".

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, irrigation equipment etc.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is a fisherman from the town of CPG, Bohol. Dennis is a married man and has two children . He has been in the fishing business for more than 2 years now. This is the source of his income.
Dennis is asking for a loan to buy paint for the fishing boat and nets for fishing. Through this, he will be able to improve his business as well  as his income.

loans.use: to buy paint for the fishing boat and nets for fishing

loans.name: Mubina

texts.ru:
Мубина добросовестная женщина. Ей 35 лет. Она вдова и имеет 1 сына, которому 12 лет. 
После смерти мужа она не вышла замуж во второй раз и посвятила всю свою жизнь своему ребёнку. Она работает в сельской поликлинике технической санитаркой. Она является единственной кормилицей в семье. Мубина хочет купить холодильник, так как она не имеет холодильника и летом ей очень трудно хранить молочные и мясные продукты. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 700 сомони для покупки холодильника. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mubina, aged 35, is a very conscientious woman.  She is a widow, and she has one son, who is 12.  After her husband passed away, she did not remarry but devoted her life to her child.  She works as an orderly in a rural polyclinic and she is her family's only breadwinner.

Mubina wants to buy a fridge.  She does not currently own one, and in the summer, she finds it very difficult to conserve milk and meat products.  She is requesting a loan of 700 somoni to buy a fridge.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her house.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa de 42 años de edad; esta casada y tiene 03 hijos que habitan en su casa hecha de material rustico.Ella y su esposo trabajan en el campo cultivando distintos productos de la zona como cacao orgánico y café porque son los productos más rentables de su zona.Una parte de su terreno se lo heredó su padre y gracias a ello logró comprar 2 terrenos de cultivo.Le gusta cuidar sus plantaciones de las distintas plagas que afectan su producción porque anteriormente perjudicaron sus ganancias.Hace  18 años se inició en esta labor y su principal dificultad es transportar los sacos con los granos listos para venderlos en los centros de acopio esperando recuperar el dinero que invirtió con ganancias adicionales.
Muy aparte de contar con el apoyo de su esposo contrata trabajadores del lugar para la cosecha y el retiro de maleza de sus plantaciones.Este es el segundo préstamo con KIVA y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo.En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,500 soles para comprar abono orgánico y mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 42 years old. She is married and has 3 children, who live in their house made of rustic materials. She and her husband work in the fields, cultivating different products of the area, such as organic cacao and coffee, because they are the most profitable products of this region. She inherited one part of her land from her father, and thanks to that she managed to buy two plots of arable land. She likes to watch over her crops for the different pests that affect her production, because in the past they affected her earnings. She began this work 18 months ago, and her principal difficulty is transporting the sacks with the beans when they are ready to be sold at the collection centers, where she hopes to recover the money that she invested, along with additional earnings.

Apart from having the support of her husband, she hires local laborers for the harvest and for removing weeds from her plantings. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the financial support that she receives to continue with her work. At this time, she wants to borrow 1500 PEN to buy organic compost and improve her production.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria earns a living through her food vending business . She lives with her family in the town of Anda, Bohol. Eleuteria has been engaged in the business for more than 10 years now. She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her place.
This is the source of her income.
Eleuteria is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasonings and cooking oil . Through this, she will be able to improve her business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, seasonings and cooking oil

loans.name: Juan Elvis

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 24 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeña hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeña, ya que él es padre y madre para ella; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Juan no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Computación e Informática, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con su hija y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juan trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un puesto de ventas en un mercado de su ciudad, de esta manera Juan tendrá un lugar estable y propio donde pueda atender a sus clientes, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Juan is 24 years old and lives in the city of Pisco with his young daughter, whom he loves and is his reason to live. Juan is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts into making headway for his little one, since he is both father and mother to her. Sadly as a result of limited economic resources and the need to work from a very young age, Juan was not able to pursue a professional degree in computer and information sciences. In his free time he likes to play with his daughter and sometimes cook a delicious Lomo Saltado (a traditional dish) to share with his family. On his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Juan works in his small business selling groceries. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes it is going well thanks to his good prices and the way he treats others. Juan is very grateful for Kiva lenders, since thanks to your help he will be able to buy a sales post in a market in the city. In this way Juan will have a stable location and a place of his own where he can tend to his customers so he can continue working hard to achieve his biggest dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to buy a sales post in a city market.

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en: Liberato is a merchant and farmer from the town of Alicia, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the business for more than 25 years now. He sells various goods and items to the people in his place. He also grows rice in his farm. Liberato is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries for his store like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods and fertilizer for the farm. Liberato believes that this loan could help him improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for his store like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is a 47-year-old father who has three school-aged children. He is raising his family in a rural community. They make their living through farming. Despite the hardships of life, he still has the determination to uplift their living status. Aside from farming, he also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, he plans to raise more pigs to sell. Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional of 15,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He is hoping that his loan request will be granted so that he can make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 51 years old. He lives in the small village of Adigeni District with his wife, 2 sons and parents. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. Roman requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land, where potatoes are grown and they maintain 17 beehives. They sell the harvested potatoes and honey at a good price, but it is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Roman requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Roman has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people  who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Roman will purchase calves. After the calves are grown, they will be able to produce dairy products to sell, increasing the income of their family. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has no children and has been doing this work for 5 years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Good returns." His biggest challenge is transportation. One animal on the farm has been given the name of Tui.

Collins likes the low interest rates that Juhudi Kilimo offers. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, and he talked about group coordination. 

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. He hopes the loan will improve his family's living conditions. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Collins owns a cow and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, poultry, a pump, a bicycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in his household, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player. 

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase milking cans.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives in Kisauni, where she has a business. She has been a merchant for four years and has clients in Kisauni and the surrounding areas. She sells house utensils like plates, spoons, and cooking pots. She began by selling food and gradually added more stock, and today she offers a broad selection.

She is working hard to achieve her dream of owning a larger store where she could sell a variety of things. She has applied for a loan to buy household utensils to replenish her inventory. She is a hardworking, enterprising woman.

loans.use: to buy household utensils to replenish her inventory.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is from Kisauni. She is married and has 2 children. She has a grocery store and sells products in the area of Kisauni.

She is a very hardworking person and a fighter, who does everything in order to improve her financial situation and give her family what they need. 

She is applying for this loan to buy supplies for her grocery store, such as fruit, vegetables, meats, bulk products, flour, rice, noodles, herbs, and other items, in order to continue providing her customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store, such as fruit, vegetables, meats, bulk products, flour, rice, noodles, herbs, and other items.

loans.name: Eloy Richard

texts.es:
Eloy es un hombre de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa, en el distrito de Parcona, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Eloy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eloy trabaja como vigilante brindando servicios de seguridad en una empresa de materiales de construcción de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Eloy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que al acercarse la época de invierno y lluvias desea refaccionar el techado de su casa, de esta manera Eloy y su familia tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran que con el apoyo de su esposa tener un buen restaurante.
texts.en: Eloy is 28 years old and lives with his wife in the city of Ica, district of Parcona. He is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts into making headway for his family. Sadly as a result of a lack of resources and the necessity to work from a very young age, Eloy was not able to pursue a civil engineering degree as he hoped. In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friend and on occasion cooking a rich Carapulca con Sopa Seca (a traditional dish) to share with his family. On his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Eloy works as a security guard for a construction materials company in his city. He works every day for approximately 12 hours, and believes it is going well thanks to his good performance and the friendly way he treats others. Eloy is very grateful for Kiva lenders, because thanks to your support he will be able to make improvements to his home, since the winter rainy season is approaching and he wants to repair his roof. In this way, Eloy and his family will have more safety and comfort, so he will continue working hard with the support of his wife to achieve his biggest dream of having a good restaurant.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married and has three minor children who go to school. She lives in her modest house in Kisauni. 

Alice sells food. She has had her own food business for approximately 10 years, making the food that she sells. She has an excellent reputation because of the quality of the products that she sells. She makes her sales in Kisauni zone. She now has a well-established customer base.

She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients like flour, rice and sugar, to make the food she sells. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, rice and sugar to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Frazia

texts.en: Frazia is 32 years old, married and has two children who attend school. She sells bananas and has been in this business for the past 15 years. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is getting ahead and makes an effort to grow. She says that she has good experience in this area because she has been in the grocery business for a long time. She also says that the previous Kiva loan allowed her to make many improvements and continue to grow. Eunice’s goal is to continue expanding her business.

She is asking for this loan to buy products such as baked goods, canned goods, noodles, dairy products, and other necessary items for her store so she can continue her sales. She is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy products, such as baked goods, canned goods, noodles, dairy products, and other necessary supplies for her store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 33 years old. She sells beer and has been in the business for the past six years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more local brews for sale.

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of seven partners, Diana, Vida, Emilia, Linda, Rebeccah, Mary and Christiana. They have been together from 2011 to date. They reside in the Teshie community. They trade in yams, fish, provisions, charcoal and food stuffs, respectively.

Diana is a 49-year-old yam seller. She is married to Joseph, a 52-year-old trader. They are blessed with three children. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and doing very well in her business.
She has been in this business for six years now. She is grateful to ID Ghana for the training on savings which has motivated her to save to achieve her dream. 
This is her third loan and she needs GHS 700 to buy more yams so that she will be able to sell more to her customers.  

They need a total amount of GHS 3400 so that they can serve customers better.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
