Зарифа запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота. Она планирует закупать по 4-х голов крупнорогатого скота, откармливать их в течение двух месяцев и затем продавать на скотном рынке с наценкой. У нее имеется место для разведения скота. В новом бизнесе ей будет помогать семья. Зарифа очень надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Zarifa is 25, and married. She lives with her husband, daughter, and parents in Spitamen. Her husband operates a private taxi service. Her in-laws are high school teachers. Zarifa herself is involved in farming. Now she would like to start a business in animal husbandry. She is requesting a loan for buying and selling cattle. She is planning to buy four head of cattle, and fatten them for two months, and then sell them on the livestock market at a profit. She has a good place for the cattle. Her family is going to help her with the business, Zarifa is counting heavily on your support.

loans.use: to buy four cows for fattening and later resale

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Ms Jamila is a 51-year-old married woman. She has 6 children; two of them are married. She is doing her own business of milk sales for a period of about 30 years. She expended all her life for providing better future to her family. She is getting older but still doing her business with devotion and dedication. She needs money to buy veterinary medicine as some of cows are getting old so she requested for a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase feed for her cows with the packs of veterinary medicines. She is in her 9th loan cycle and is one of good clients of Kashf. She expects boost in her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cows with the packs of veterinary medicines.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Ms Shazia is a 32-year-old energetic lady. She got married when she was only 18 years old. Now she has 4 children; all is school going. Three years ago she started her own business of milk sales with the support of Kashf foundation. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. To cater more people of her community she needs to purchase another buffalo. For this she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. Shazia wishes to generate profit from her business by utilizing this loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Ms Nazia is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 6 children; she is struggling hard to meet their needs as her husband’s income is not sufficient to run his household alone. That is why five years ago, she initiated her own business of milk sales to contribute in the family income. Now she has 3 cows and 2 buffaloes and sells their milk in her community and in the local market. She earns enough money to fulfill the basic necessity of life. She requested for a loan of Rs. 25000 to buy more cow. She is in her 1st loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more cow.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Ms Saima is a 20-year-old lady. For about 6 years she is been in work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors with the packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. Saima desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors with the packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Ms Zareena is a 33-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband is employed in a textile mill but his income is not sufficient to meet the increasing demands of his family. Zareena decided to support her husband by doing business herself. For this purpose she started a business of milk sales  with the help of Kashf Foundation. Initially she bought a buffalo with the loan amount. Over the time she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She is in her 5th loan cycle; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She expects boost in her earnings and plans to spend the part of profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en: Ms Kouser is a 40-year-old married woman doing a business of selling milk for the past 6 years. She has two buffaloes and two cows in milk. The only source of earning is her milk production business. She is a mother of 5 children; all is school going. She knows the importance of education and wants to provide education to her children for their bright and prosperous future. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. She is in her 10th loan cycle. Now she requested for a loan of Rs 50,000 to Kashf Foundation to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to get increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en: Ms Seema is a 47-year-old married woman. She has six children. Twenty years ago she started her own business of milk sales to provide financial support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family members. Seema's husband is employed in a textile mill but his income is not sufficient to meet household expenses alone. By the time, Seema has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family income. Currently she requested a loan of Rs. 60,000 loan to purchase one more buffalo. She has been in association with Kashf since eight years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She expects boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend the part of profit to meet the growing demands of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Manzar

texts.ru: Манзар молодой и активный парень в возрасте 24 лет. Он пока не женат и не имеет детей. Но он очень любит детей и в скором времени собирается жениться. А сейчас Манзар живёт вместе со своими  родителями. После окончания школы Манзар поступил в педагогическое училище, закончил его и получил профессию учителя. После чего он устроился на работу учителем в колледж, где и работает по сей день. Но зарплата учителя маленькая, и её не хватает на достойное проживание. Поэтому Манзар начал свой маленький бизнес и хочет постепенно его развивать, чтобы этот бизнес приносил хороший доход ему и его семье. Он занимается купля-продажей продуктов питания, для этого у него имеется собственный магазин. Но так как Манзар работает в колледже, он не может всё время находится в магазине. И пока Манзар находится на работе в колледже, в магазине помогает продавать его мама. Сейчас Манзар хочет увеличить ассортимент продуктов в своём магазине, чтобы удовлетворять больше нужд населения. Поэтому он хочет закупить много разнообразного вида продуктов для дальнейшей продажи  и этим самым увеличить свой товарооборот. Для этого он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для покупки продуктов питания и заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Manzar is a young, active fellow of 24. He is still single and does not have any children. But he loves children very much and plans to get married soon. Manzar currently lives with his parents. After graduating from school, Manzar went to a pedagogical institute, graduated, and received his teacher's diploma. He then became a college teacher, where he is still employed. But a teacher's salary is small, and it doesn't pay for a decent place to live. So Manzar started his own small business and wants to expand it gradually, so that it provides a good income for him and his family. He sells food products, and has his own shop. But because Manzar has a job at the college, he can't be at his shop all of the time, and his mother helps him out. Now Manzar wants to increase his shop's assortment of merchandise so he can better meet the needs of his customers. So he wants to buy a lot of many different types of products to increase his sales. To accomplish this, he turned to Arvand and to requesting a loan to buy food products. He thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Idrees

texts.en: Ms Idrees is a 42-year-old married woman doing a business of milk sales for the past 20 years. She put lots of efforts to provide healthy life for her family. She has five adult children. After facing hard time she decided to start her own business. She bought a cow by taking loan from Kashf foundation and sells its milk to the people near her house by going door to door. She needs more money to fulfill the increasing demands of her customers so she requested for a loan Rs. 35,000 to buy one more buffalo to carter more customers. She is her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation; she is already doing fantastic job in her field and hopes to get increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Ms Nazia is 29 years old married woman. She has three children; two of them is school going. For the past 05 years, she has been successfully running a business of animals’ sales. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. Her husband is a labor whose income is on daily basis that is not enough to meet household expenses. That’s why she took initiative and started her own business and now makes enough to contribute to her family’s income. She is very motivated to provide her children a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. It’s her 2nd year in Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with the support of it. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another cow. She hopes get boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Byambajargal

texts.en:
Byambajargal is 25 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He is a blue collar worker at a printing company, which he has been doing since 2010. His wife sells children's clothes by renting stall at a trade center near their home. 

When Byambajargal was a student at the university, he began building his house and in three years he has finished the outer building and currently needs some interior decoration. He is requesting a loan for 6,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, iron door, and some insulation materials such as fiberglass, cotton, and gypsum. As a result, he can improve his living condition, reduce his family's use of coal, release less pollutants, and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows, iron door, and hardwood floors

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth es soltera y tiene un hijo de 4 años aun no asiste al colegio, viven en casa de su abuelita materna, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Rio Seco  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario ,ella tiene una pequeña libreria en la cual ofrece a su clientela una gran variedad de utiles escolares ademas regalos y diferentes adornos, la libreria queda ubicada frente a un colegio .
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir una serie de tarjetas  y regalos ya que se acerca el dia de la madre, asi podra aumentar su capital de trabajo.
El sueño de Lizeth es ampliar su negoxio y tener un bazar completo.
Es la segunda  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Lizeth is single and has a 4-year-old son who does not yet attend school.  They live in her maternal grandmother's house which is located in the Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto.

Lizeth has a high school level of education.  She has a small bookstore where she offers her customers a wide range of school supplies as well as gifts and decorations.  The store is located opposite a school.

Lizeth needs this loan to buy a series of cards and gifts as Mothers Day is approaching.  This will allow her to increase her working capital. 

Lizeth's dream is to expand her business and have a well-stocked general store.  This is the second time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the second from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy Mothers Day (27th of May in Bolivia) cards and gifts to improve her income

loans.name: Justa

texts.en:
Justa is a member of the group called Mujeres Capacitadas, located in the city of Puerto Plata. This is her 12th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for around six years. She has paid back all her loans and expanded her business. After her last loan, which she invested in her business, she realized the need to finish building her home structure.

This is the reason why she talked to other members of her group and they recommended her for a housing loan to improve her home by covering the concrete blocks walls with cement, painting them and also to cover the floor with ceramics or tiles and to buy windows and doors. This loan will be used totally to buy all materials to build those areas. Justa is the mother of 4 children and she lives together with them in her unfinished house. 

Esperanza International runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

She thanks God, Esperanza International and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cement and ceramics, etc.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro is a member of the group called Mujeres Capacitadas, located in a rural area of the city of Puerto Plata. This is his 11th loan, which he will use to improve his house. He has had his business of selling fruits and vegetables, started from his savings, for over thirty years, and now he is running a grocery or food store.

After his last loan, which he invested in his business, Isidro realized the need to improve his home structure. With this housing loan he is able to take, and with his business profits, he can pay for the home improvements and save for more. The other members of his group are recommending him for a housing loan to start with the house construction. Now he will build his house roof, and build up his deteriorated wood walls with concrete blocks.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Isidro lives together with his long term partner and one of his three children. He thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In his name and that of his family, he thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cement, zinc, wood, concrete blocks, etc.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose, 33, owns and is the sole employee of Final Touch Mobile Wash and Detail, a car wash business he began in his hometown of El Paso, Texas.  Though he has only been in business for one month, Jose already has plans to expand his business and hire additional employees.

Knowing he would need extra business assistance, Jose turned to Accion Texas Inc. at one of their many business service workshops in El Paso. 

He applied, and was approved for a $5,450 loan he is using to purchase a truck to enhance the presentation of his mobile car wash and to build local awareness of his business. Jose is happy with his loan and says without it, he would have been hindered in reaching certain business goals.

loans.use: to purchase a truck.

loans.name: Fiordaliza

texts.en:
Fiordaliza, from the city of Puerto Plata, is one of the members of the group Mujeres Capacitadas taking a housing loan. This is her 6th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for over six years, having started it with her own capital, working by visiting neighbors and offering them manicures and pedicures. Her latest loan was invested in her business, which is a beauty salon.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business, and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their businesses and attending their group meetings.

Fiordaliza wants to continue building her house, and with this loan she will change some deteriorated wood walls for concrete blocks. Also she will make some changes in her business location that is part of her house. She is requesting this loan to buy cement, concrete blocks, zinc and other building materials. 

Fiordaliza thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, thanks to all of you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi lives in the town of Kisauni with her husband and three school-age children. She has a sewing workshop in her home. She takes on jobs from her customers who are located in the market district. Her husband helps her in the business. 

She says that she previously used to sell hens in the market, and her husband worked as a pool attendant, but when the sewing business gradually took off they started working at it full time.

Mwanahamisi is requesting this loan to invest in her sewing workshop. She will buy fabric, threads, buttons and other supplies so that she can continue growing and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy fabric, threads, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is getting ahead and makes an effort to grow. She says that she has good experience in this area because she has been doing this for a long time. She also says that the previous Kiva loan allowed her to make many improvements and continue to grow. Margaret’s goal is to continue expanding her business.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as fish for her store so she can continue her sales. She is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as fish for her store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has three children, two of whom attend school.  She is from Kisauni. Florence has a stall in town, where she sells fruits and green vegetables.

Florence is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy mangoes, watermelons, bananas, and vegetables so that she can continue working to meet her goals. Thanks to her work, she is able to help her children finish their studies and pay for all their household needs. She is a dedicated person who has demonstrated that she works hard to meet her obligations.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, watermelons, bananas, and vegetables

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married to Charles, who is a businessman. They have three school-aged children.

Margaret buys, packages, and sells hardwood charcoal. At first she used to buy the charcoal already packaged, but she was able to expand their storage area and she can now store up to 15,000 kg of charcoal. She buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal, and sells it to small businesses in the zone. She makes her sales from a small cart. 

She needs this loan to buy charcoal because she is increasing the number of customers and needs to increase the amount of charcoal to meet their demands. 

Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her three children, who attend school, so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is single, and lives with her parents in Kisauni, Mombasa. She is the daughter of a painter who is very well-known in the area. At a very young age she started helping her parents by buying clothing and other products for resale. She has built up a very good customer base because of her good pricing and variety of products. For this reason, she wants to be able to invest in her business.

She is requesting this loan to purchase shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and other garments because these are in high demand this season. She is grateful for this opportunity, since it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and other garments.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is from Kisauni. She is married and they have children. They live for their children, so they strive to do their best.

Fatuma produces and sells food from home. She says that, thanks to her efforts, he business has been growing and now has a very good clientele. Fatuma wants to be able to improve with each passing day. Both she and her husband are hardworking and enterprising individuals.

Fatuma will use her loan to buy supplies for making her products such as flour, yeast, salt, sugar and other items. These purchases will allow her to continue offering her customers good products like the ones she currently makes.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, salt, sugar and other items to make food products.

loans.name: Filomena Gladys

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena tiene 59 años, casada con un hijos que tiene la edad de 18 años,  que se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, ella  se dedica  a la confección de variedad de prendas desde hace ya varios años ella confecciona billeteras  y muñecas de tela en su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona Mario Mercado,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Filomena va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de sus prendas  ya que tiene pedidos que entregar al por mayor a una institución muy conocida que vende juguetes artesanales, educativos y didácticos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión,   La Sra. Filomena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de sus muñecas y así tener más pedidos de clientes , La Sra. Filomena es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esto le permite mejorar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Filomena is 59 years old and married.  She has an 18 year old son who is studying at the university.  She makes a variety of clothes.  For several years she has been making wallets and dolls from fabric in her workshop.   Her workshop is in her home, which is in the Mario Mercado area.

This loan is her first cycle with the institution.  Filomena will use this loan to buy fabric to make clothes.  She has wholesale orders to deliver to a very well-known institution that sells educational and learning artisan toys.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase investment capital.

Filomena faces the challenge in her business of increasing her income.  She will use the profits to buy materials for making her dolls.  This way she will have more customer orders.

Filomena is a very hard-working person.  She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support given.  This allows her to improve her income.

video.title: Kiva Borrower FILOMENA GLADYS  from Bolivia

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale in order to make wallets and dolls.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un  préstamo porque requiere de mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar un carretón de papitas, jugos, gaseosas, gatorade, golosinas, ropa y artículos de revista; esta inversion le ayudara a obtener más inventario para llevar a cabo su actividad y optimizar los ingresos.
El credito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: Ana is requesting a loan because she needs more working capital in order to continue growing her business. These funds will help her purchase a cart of potato chips, juices, soft drinks, sports drinks, snacks, clothing, and magazines. This investment will help her increase her inventory and continue working and maximizing her income. Her previous loan helped her improve her family's financial conditions and circumstances.

loans.use: purchase a cart of potato chips, juices, soft drinks, sports drinks, snacks, clothing, and magazines.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin J. is from the Dominican Republican. He lives in Laredo, which borders Mexico along the Rio Grande in Texas. There are many different types of Mexican restaurants there, but there were few serving the traditional fried plantain dishes of his home country. Fortunately for Melvin J. and Laredo, his wife is an excellent cook. Together, the couple decided to open a Caribbean restaurant called Restaurant Grandes Ligas last year. 

“We saw an opportunity,” Melvin J. said.

The restaurant is open from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day of the week. Melvin J. said he works the front of the restaurant and his wife works the back as the cook. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner, and offer everything from jelly-filled Cuban breads to licuados de mamay or papaya – tropical fruit smoothies -- for breakfast. In addition to serving mofongo con camaron – fried mashed plantains covered in a shrimp stew – Grandes Ligas serves tacos and other Mexican food.

“People asked for the breakfast tacos, so we offer them,” he said. 

When Melvin J. realized he needed some help with financing the painting and operation of his restaurant, he knew to apply with Accion Texas Inc. One and a half years ago, Melvin J. applied for and received a $500 Accion Texas loan to stock the shelves of another business he owns – a botánica or traditional herbs and medicines store called Yerberia San Miguel. He quickly paid Accion back and knew that doing so would help him build his credit and become eligible for a larger loan.

At his restaurant, Melvin J. said he serves a loyal clientele of people who love his wife’s cooking and the cozy atmosphere dedicated to Major League Baseball. Currently the restaurant employs two people – Melvin J. and his wife – and is large enough for six tables. One day Melvin J. said he would like to expand his restaurant so he can hire more people and serve more customers. For the time being, he is getting known for his international cuisine, one happy stomach at a time.

loans.use: to fund painting and restaurant operation.

loans.name: Natalie

texts.en:
Natalie is the President of Happy 2 Help U Cleaning Service LLC, a cleaning service company for residential and commercial buildings in the greater Los Angeles area, the San Fernando Valley, and the coastal areas of San Diego. Happy 2 Help U promises to deliver exceptional customer service to all of its clients by offering services such as property maintenance and preservation, window washing, power washing, metal fixture polishing, and much more.

In 2005, Natalie left her job at a film and television studio in order to pursue a possible career advancement opportunity. Unfortunately, things fell through and Natalie found herself wondering what would happen. 

“Instead of drowning in uncertainty, I decided it was a good time to start a small business that I could get up and running,” she said.

As a result of her new business endeavor, Happy 2 Help U was born. For eight years now, Natalie has operated from a spare room in her house. She is currently looking to grow and expand her business into her two-car garage. Natalie is looking for a $5,000 loan in order to be able to continue her dream of running her cleaning service business. The funds will be used for Internet advertising and marketing to the local community, and to bring in extra office support.

With a Bachelor’s of Science degree from Cal State Dominguez Hills and over 15 years of experience in the field, Natalie feels that her Happy 2 Help U Cleaning Service is poised for success.

loans.use: To pay for internet advertising and marketing to the local community, and to bring in extra office support.

loans.name: Yudelka

texts.en:
Yudelka is a member of the group called Trabajando para el futuro (Working for the future), located in the city of Puerto Plata. Yudelka is the single mother of 4 children and she lives together with them in her unfinished house. This is her 6th loan, which she will use to improve her house. She has had her business for around five years. Since then she has paid back all her loans and expanded her business. After her last loan, which she invested in her business, she realized the need to finish building her home structure. 

This is the reason why she talked to other members of her group and they recommended her for a housing loan to improve her home by building some concrete blocks walls and covering them with cement. She will also change a part of her zinc roof that is very damaged. This loan, along with some savings she had from her business profits, will be used totally to buy all the materials to improve those areas.

Esperanza International runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings.

Yudelka thanks God, Esperanza International and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and that of her family, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, concrete blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Gensia

texts.en:
Gensia makes a living selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and rice, and thanks to her efforts she has been able to continue with her business. She is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business and to supporting her family. 

Gensia has expanded and improved her overall business as well as the quality of her products. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman makes a living selling cereals like beans and maize as well as operating a beauty salon business, and thanks to his previous Kiva loan, he has been able to continue with his businesses. He is a very hardworking man who is dedicated to his businesses and to supporting his family.
 
Thanks to his previous loan, Suleiman expanded and improved his business as well as the quality of his products. He plans to use the support from this loan to purchase sacks of beans and maize. He is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans and maize.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a merchant who makes a living buying and selling fish. She has been dedicated to this activity for more than ten years, so she already has some good experience. Kanze has her own boat, nets and fishing equipment, which helps her work without depending on anyone. She is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help her family. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase fish, which will increase her stock since demand is high and she wants to be able to satisfy her customers. Kanze is grateful for the loan she is receiving from Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Joeliza

texts.en:
Joeliza is 24 years old, married, and has two children.  She is a native of Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte  Joeliza.operates a fishing boat business with her husband, which she has been doing for five years.  She earns approximately 40,000 PHP a month.
  
Joeliza is requesting a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase fishing supplies.  She has been a member of PMPC for almost three years and maintains a good repayment record.  In the future, Joeliza hopes to have good living conditions and a progressive business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing supplies.

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 48 años de edad es una mujer  muy alegre y soñadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 15, 6 y 3 años respectivamente.El trabajo de Martha  consiste en la venta de comida como pollo frito, hamburguesas, arroz chaufa,  guiso de pollo, entre otros. Realiza esta actividad en el frontis de su casa propia y cada día al atardecer saca sus utensilios como mesas, sillas, platos, cucharas, etc. Se inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad de apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y también tener un empleo  con el cual pueda ayudar en los gastos de su hogar.En el futuro espera construir un local en el interior de su vivienda y poner un restaurante que funcione todo el día,  y generar más ganancias económicas.Este será su préstamo número 06 con Kiva y está contenta de recibir un apoyo financiero que le ayude a incrementar sus ganancias además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 600 soles comprará ingredientes como arroz, huevos, condimentos, panes, entre otros productos .
texts.en:
Martha, age 48, is a very happy woman, and she is a dreamer.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children, ages 15, 6, and 3.  Martha’s work consists of selling food like fried chicken, hamburgers, fried rice, and chicken stew, among others.

She conducts this business activity in front of her own house.  Each day at sunset she gets out her tools like tables, chairs, plates, and spoons, etc.  She started this business activity from the need to support her children’s education and to have a job with which to help with the household expenses.

In the future she hopes to build a place inside her home and to set up a restaurant to be open all day and to generate more income.

This will be her sixth loan with Kiva.  She is happy to receive financial support that will help her to increase her profits.  Also, she pledges to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 600 soles to buy more ingredients like rice, eggs, condiments, and bread, among other products.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like rice, eggs, condiments, and bread, among other products.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lourdes Vanesa

texts.es:
Lourdes, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo para su negocio; este le permitirá comprar diversidad de mercadería para ofrecerle a sus clientes tales como: blusas, camisa, pantalones, chores, overol, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar las ganancias  e incrementar la clienta por la mercadería disponible a su gusto; las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Lourdes needs a new loan as she needs more working capital for her business.  This loan will allow her to buy a range of merchandise to offer her customers such as blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, overalls, etc.

Lourdes' previous loan helped her to increase her profits and her number of customers as she had merchandise available to suit their tastes.  Both her family situation and her financial situation have improved.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, shorts, overalls, etc.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu sells cooked food from her cafe to the general public. She faces the major challenges of seasonality in her business and the lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase foodstuff like maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff like maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a single man and he lives in his own home with his parents.

He has had a garage shop for more than one year. Rashid is a very self-sacrificing man, and his garage shop is 2 km from his home. Previously he did side jobs which earned another source of living.

At first, Rashid just bought tools and initially ran his garage shop from home until he had sufficient capital. He then brought used tools with the capital and set up in a strategic premises next to a gas station on a main highway entering town. Today he has an established customer base founded on his good service and the good quality of his work. 

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of equipment and spare parts for motor vehicles with which he can be stocked up and so meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and spare parts for his garage shop.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 10 children. 

Erlinda is engaged in snack vending and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repair.

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a hardworking person. He operates a motorcycle transport business in a busy town, and this enables him to serve his customers. He says that he wants to continue working because this is the only way he can help his family and provide them with what they need to continue growing. 

He is requesting this loan to repair his motorcycle and purchase spare parts, which will enable him to continue meeting customer demand. He is grateful for this new assistance that he is receiving.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Mwingo

texts.en:
Mwingo is a hardworking and enterprising man who is getting ahead and making an effort to grow. He is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as meats, fruits, drinks, vegetables, and other things for his store so he can continue his sales.

He says that he has good experience in this area because he has been doing this for four years now. He also says that his business has allowed him to make many improvements and continue to grow. 

Mwingo’s goal is to continue expanding his business. He is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as meats, fruits, drinks, vegetables, and other things for his store.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is married and has school-age children.  She lives in Kisauni.  Anne has a sewing workshop in her home. She takes on jobs from her customers who are located in the market district. She used to sell clothes in the market but when the sewing business gradually took off she started working  full time.

Anne is requesting a loan, which she will use to invest in her sewing workshop. She will buy fabric, threads, buttons, and other supplies so that she can continue expanding and improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, threads, buttons, and other supplies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
A hardworking woman is from Baybay Tinagsa, Kolambugan, Lanao Del Norte, Alma is 45 years old. She is separated with seven children.

Alma owns a mini-grocery store that sells goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional stock for her store. 
        
Alma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. She is one of PMPC's members in good standing. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her living conditions and continue to support her children despite the status of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her store.

location.town: Ozamiz - Baybay Tinagsa, Kolambugan, Lanao Del Nor

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
This widow with four adult-aged children is from Libertad, Kolambugan, Lanao Del Norte. She is Esmeralda, a 63-year-old who is engaged in dried fish selling. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for additional capital to purchase additional kilos of dried fish to expand her business.         

Esmeralda has been a member of PMPC for one year and makes it a point to pay the loans in a timely manner. In the future, Esmeralda hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of dried fish.

location.town: Ozamiz - Libertad, Kolambugan, Lanao Del Norte

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, age 44, runs a general store business to earn an income. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. She and her husband have two children and live in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

Arlene joined GDMPC in 2010 and has been a member in good standing ever since. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000, which she will use to purchase canned goods and bottled products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this investment to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and bottled products for sale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita started her business  selling vegetables on a small scale in her village. When she had enough experience in managing a small business, Teresita engaged herself in planting and harvesting citrus fruit in her field. She realizes that managing this type of business requires hard work to gain higher income.

Teresita dreams of owning and managing a small agricultural supply soon. She has to work hard and grow her planted citrus on her farm to get better yield and better income as well. Teresita is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and to pay the labor costs of harvesting her citrus fruit. She hopes to gain higher income and save some of it to start pursuing her dreams.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay the labor costs of harvesting her citrus fruit.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: El Sr. Alex  tiene 30 años,  tiene dos  hijos de las edades de 6 años, el se dedica a la construcción de puertas y muebles de cocina,  tiene su carpintería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Plan 3000 de la ciudad de Santa Cruz  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya 10 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también era carpintero,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Alex  utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de madera para la construcción de puertas , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material de trabajo, ya que sin esto no podría realizar puertas,  el Sr. Alex enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Alex, age 30, has two six year old children.  He builds doors and kitchen furniture.  His carpentry business is in the Plan 3000 area in the city of Santa Cruz.  He has been engaged in this business activity for ten years.  He learned how to do this from his father, who also was a carpenter.

This loan is his first cycle with the institution.  Alex will use this loan to buy wood to build doors.  His reason for requesting this loan is the lack of capital to buy this work material.  Without it, he would not be able to make doors.

Alex faces the challenge in his business of getting out of poverty.  He will use the profits to improve his quality of life.  This is his only business activity that allows him to support himself and his family.  For this reason he is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a long-standing client of Yehu Microfinance. She is married and lives in her home in the town of Kisauni. Her business is selling fruit juices.

Salma is a person who has a desire to make progress and get ahead in life. She always works hard so that she can provide her family with everything they need. Her dream is to have a large business premises. 

She is requesting this loan to buy more fruits and a refrigerator for storing juices so that she can continue working toward her dreams. She is grateful for the opportunity that Yehu Microfinance is giving her once again, as she would like to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and a refrigerator for storing juices.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 59 years old, married and has children. She is from Poblacion, Bonifacio. To make a living, Conchita manages her own farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale, which she has been doing for four years.  

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is aged 28. She is married with three children aged between 2 and 8 years. She sells carrots and hens. With the loan, she will buy more carrots for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more carrots for sale.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 54 years old. She sells beer and has been doing for many years. This business has brought her many successes. With the loan, she will buy more beers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees for her children. She is very thankful for the previous loan that helped her to upgrade her business as well as improve the live lives of her family members. She has decided to get a small loan for this second loan because of her energy for doing business.

loans.use: to buy more beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
42-year-old Mzia lives in Senaki district with her husband, parents-in-law and 14-year-old daughter. Mzia requested loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is Mzia’s parents-in-laws monthly pension. The income totals 300 GEL and it’s rarely enough for food for them.

Mzia requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Mzia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit, Mzia will start trading clothes. She will purchase at wholesale prices from the big market in Senaki district and resell them at a premium among the villagers. This will give her an opportunity to earn additional income for the family and improve their living conditions. She will reinvest part of the profit in the same field, in order to develop her trading.

loans.use: to start trading clothes.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, los cuales tienen edades  de 1, 3 y 6 años. El se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos tales como: tomates y loroco; el oficio de la agricultura lo aprendió desde muy pequeño, además tiene conocimientos de carpintería, el cual hoy en día le genera ingresos.
El préstamo que requiere le ayudara a adquirir los insumos agrícolas para realizar el cultivo,  entre ellos están: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas; este le facilitara tener sin problemas todo lo necesario para su trabajo, uno de los riesgos seria la escasez de lluvia.
Su sueño es adquirir un terreno para construir una casa más grande y así colocar  su propio taller de carpintería con la ayuda de la Institución.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his life partner and his three children who are 1, 3 and 6 years old.  His business is sowing basic grains such as tomatoes and 'loroco' (a native edible flower).  He learned how to farm when he was very young and also has carpentry skills which he uses to make income.

The loan that Manuel is requesting will help him to acquire the farm inputs he needs to grow his crops.  He needs fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides.  This will help him to have available everything he needs to carry out his work.  One of the risks he faces is a lack of rain.

Manuel's dream is to acquire a plot of land where he can build a bigger house and install his own carpentry workshop with the institution's help.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean’s passion for building and construction began when he was a child who he loved creating and building structures out of blocks and legos. Fascinated by the architecture of his hometown, Chicago, Sean always knew he wanted to build structures and houses. 

As an adult, Sean’s passion for seeing a project through and building something of value propelled him into the construction business.  Sean honed his trade working on extensive reconstruction and repair of Navy barracks.  He reflects that his time there taught him just how important your team is and how important it is for each member to work hard.

In January 2011, Sean started his own construction firm, fulfilling his lifelong dream of becoming an entrepreneur.  Almost two and a half years later, Sean's business has grown and expanded, providing Sean with the opportunity to positively affect the lives of many individuals and their families.  For Sean, the best part of his job is providing quality service in home renovation that not only creates a beautiful new space, but also restores and protects the special memories of the homeowner.  

A loan of $7,332.90 will enable Sean to purchase equipment necessary to expand his construction business further.  Sean will also use the loan to pursue a public works contract in San Diego to restore historic San Diego buildings.  This is a huge growth opportunity for Sean and his business. 

In the future, Sean hopes to grow his business to the point where he can add jobs to the community and mentor younger generations in his trade.  Currently, Sean hires three part-time contractors as needed, but with further expansion, he can hire full-time employees and achieve his dream of passing on his craft.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Sean from United States

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment and pursue a public works contract.

loans.name: Kaddi

texts.en:
Kaddi is from the Kisauni area. She is married to Charo, who is a fisherman. They have five children who all attend school. Kaddi's business is buying, producing and selling vegetables. She makes her sales to neighboring food stall operators and in Kisauni town market. She tells us that she has an established customer base which helps her to make a very good income and thereby help her family.

Kaddi is requesting a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc. She tells us that this will enable her to stock up and have a larger variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc.

loans.name: Brígida Isabel

texts.es:
Brígida tiene 47 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene una hija de 14 años de edad. Ella tiene 12 años de ser profesora, le gusta enseñar a los niños y jóvenes en la escuela.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar una deuda pendiente. De esta manera saldrá de sus compromisos financieros con tasas muy altas de interés; lo que le permitirá ahorrarse dinero. Su deseo es ayudar a su hija para que continúe con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Brígida is 47 years old.  She is in a relationship and she has a 14-year-old daughter.  She has been a teacher for 12 years.  She likes to teach the children and young people in the school.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to pay off an outstanding debt.  In this way she will get out of her financial commitments with very high interest rates and that will allow her to save money. 

Her wish is to help her daughter continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay off an outstanding debt.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren, 39, lives with her husband, son and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been babysitting one company's CEO's child since 2009. Her husband has been rendering taxi services to local people for many years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her son studies at an agricultural university. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 5000000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using these materials, she and her husband can repair and insulate their house. The renovated house will enable the family to reduce their coal consumption, release less pollutants, thereby contributing to efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en: Aimable is 42 years old. He is married with two children. He has requested a loan for buying more construction materials to sell. With the loan, he will add more iron sheets and nails for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more iron sheets and nails to sell.

loans.name: Ukumbini

texts.en:
Ukumbini is married and has two school aged children. She is from Kisauni.  Ukumbini sells prepared foods, which she has been doing for five years. 

Ukumbini is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a water tank for storing water to sell. She dreams of opening another location and providing a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for storing water to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 32 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. The loan for the business will be used to buy more bananas and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and rice to sell.

loans.name: America

texts.es:
América, de 55  años de edad, está casada con Julio quien es empleado y padre de sus 2 hijos.  Juntos  están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa en compañía de su hijo menor de 12 años de edad respectivamente.América se dedica a la venta de comidas en las noches tales como pescado asado, tallarines y otros. Para eso instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa donde atiende muy amablemente a todos sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y transeúntes de la zona. Comenta que ha suspendido temporalmente sus actividades por problemas de salud, pero lo estará retomando en el transcurso de las semanas.Lleva más de 06 años en éste negocio, empezando con un capital propio , considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene ya que en su zona es muy conocida y solicitada, siendo sus vecinas quienes le piden que retome su negocio.Este será el préstamo número 06 con Kiva y está contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar  sus planes , por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará utensilios para su negocio tales como ollas, vasos, platos, y otros, además de mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
América, 55 years old, is married to Julio who is employed and father of her two children. They live together in their own home with their youngest child who is less than 12 years old.

América works selling food in the evenings such as grilled fish, noodles, and more. To do this she sets up a table in front of her home where she offers friendly service to her customers, mainly her neighbors and passersby from the area. She says that she has temporarily suspended her activities due to health problems, but will be resuming in the coming weeks. She has been in this business for more than six years, beginning with her own capital. She considers the business very profitable because the need in her area is well known and sought after, and her neighbors are asking her to resume her business.

This will be her sixth loan through Kiva and she is happy to know that she will have financial support in order to carry out her plans, and she promises to be responsible for her loan payments.

With the requested amount of 1500 soles she will buy utensils for her business, such as pots, glasses, dishes, and more, as well as tables and chairs.

loans.use: to buy utensils such as pots, glasses, dishes, and more

loans.name: Irubgu

texts.en:
Irubgu is a hardworking and enterprising man who is getting ahead and makes an effort to grow. He has good experience with his barber shop because he has been doing it for over five years now. The previous loan allowed him to make many improvements and continue to grow. Irubgu’s goal is to continue expanding his business.

Irubgu is requesting another loan, which he will use to buy another hair cutting machine so he can continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase another hair cutting machine

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 38 years old. She has sold bedsheets and bed covers for one year after shifting from selling construction materials. With the loan, she would like to buy more bedsheets for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets for sale.

loans.name: Luiza

texts.en:
Luiza is 26 years old. She lives in Marneuli District with her 35-year-old husband and retired parents-in-law. 

Several times, Luiza requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Luiza’s husband is working for the water company. Her father-in-law is working as a security guard at the local stone factory. They both get small monthly salaries. The family's additional income comes from Luiza’s parents-in-law's monthly pensions. 

Luiza requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Luiza has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Luiza will purchase grocery stocks to open a grocery shop. She has already rented a commercial space, which is in a populous area. It will help Luiza to have a good number of clients and earn a good profit. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same business, expanding the assortment of products in the shop. She will try to have all the necessary products that the locals need. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stocks to open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es: Douglas de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, yuca y fríjol, tiene 7 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, etc. Douglas tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Douglas, 34 years old, lives with his life partner and three children in their own home. 

He works growing corn, yuca, and beans. He has been working in agriculture for seven years and this has given him lots of experience permitting him to grow better crops which he sells in the surrounding community areas. He has many customers who prefer the quality, good prices and above all his good service.

He needs to invest so he is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicides, and fertilizer, etc.

Douglas has good references from associates and is responsible, and he is sure that he can pay off his loan in the established time frame and at the same time hopes to provide financial security for his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Alamdar

texts.en:
Alamdar is 49 years old, married and has four children: two sons and two daughters. His daughters go to school. His sons go to sport and music. He wants his daughters to become teachers. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Alamdar is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Kalbadjar. Now he lives in the Absheron region with his family. He started his business five years ago to makes marble for cemeteries. Now Alamdar needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy new equipment for cutting marble. He wants to use the money from his expanded business to help his family. In the future, Alamdar wants to repair and increase the size of his workshop. This will be more profitable for his business. Alamdar is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for cutting marble for cemeteries.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Rehema has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to the town residents and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by the seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es:
José,  tiene 25 años de edad, está casado y su esposa tiene 22 años de edad, disfruta de dos hijos en el cual uno de ellos, estudia parvularia. El se dedica a la ganadería, el cual lo compra y engorda; este oficio lo aprendió con un tío, cuenta con 5 años de poseerlo.
El crédito que requiere le permitirá comprar una ternera para engordarla, concentrado; este le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 25 years old, married, and his wife is 22.  He has two children and one of them goes to kindergarten.  He raises livestock, which he buys and fattens up.  He learned this from his uncle and has been doing this for five years.

He needs this loan so that he can buy a calf to fatten up and some feed.  This will help him increase his income.

His dream is to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is a married mother living with her husband and two school aged children in Kisauni, Kenya. Her husband is a mason, while Pendo sells various brands of used clothing from her home to make a living. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person who, together with her husband, overcomes obstacles that are presented to them. Thanks to their work, they are able to give their children what they need.

With the requested loan, Pendo will be able to purchase a greater quantity of clothing, and therefore be able to fulfill the needs and requests of her clients. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su familia, su esposa que tiene 47 años de edad y sus hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 7, 15 y 27 años, todos trabajan y dependen del negocio. El posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, el cual lo realiza desde hace 20 años y todos los días, lo desempeña el trabajo en casa y a domicilio.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar lámina para puertas, hierro, asimismo para soldar, entre otros; este le ayudara a tener materia prima para llevar a cabo la actividad y así vender puertas, portones, balcones, entre otros.
Su sueño es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y brindarles los estudios a sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his family. His wife is 47 years old, and his children are 7, 15 and 27 years old, all of them working and depending on the business. 

He owns a metal shop where he has been working everyday for 20 years, carrying out his work at home and in residences.

The loan that he needs will permit him to buy sheet plates for doors, iron, and for welding too, and more. This will help him to have the raw supplies he needs to carry out his work so he can sell doors, gates, balconies, and more.

His dream is to provide a better quality of life for his family and to provide his children and grandchildren an education.

loans.use: to buy sheet plates for doors, iron, welding supplies, and more

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto de 45 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos tres hijos de 15, 9 y 7 años de edad quienes estudian actualmente, el es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años: maíz y maicillo. Dagoberto desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Dagoberto is 45 years old and is a very responsible man who maintains his household obligations. He is always described for bringing the best to his children. He lives with his partner and three children, aged 15, 9 and 7, all of whom are currently studying. 

He is very hard working and has always carried out his work with pleasure and enthusiasm. He makes a living as a farmer and plants corn and baby corn each year. Dagoberto hopes to increase his sales, which is why he visited INTEGRAL's offices to ask for a loan. This loan will allow him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide and other supplies. He hopes to count on the support requested as he does not have other sources of income. In this way he will continue to be able to put food on the table each day without any problems.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is 38 years old and works in the construction industry. With this loan, he will buy more timber to sell. He also plans to use the profits he makes to purchase more timber for his business.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a married woman with four children who attend school. She is a tailor by profession and has a boutique in the center of town. Her main customers are teenagers and things are going very well for her because she always makes clothing that is innovative and well sought after. She would like to be able to continue expanding her boutique.

Rachael is asking for this loan so that she can invest in fabric and thread for her business. She wants to be able to continue working.

loans.use: buy fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 31 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is the only income source for the family, running a dyeing shop. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. He provides clothes-dyeing services in the community. 

Presently, he is in need of purchasing a clothes dyeing machine. Due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Fozia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needed equipment for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a cloth-dyeing machine for her husband's dyeing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish and vegetables

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 38 años de edad, está casada con Israel quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 05 hijos a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Julia es la venta de golosinas de diversos sabores por la mañana razón por lo cual instala un tablero en el frontis de su casa  en donde atiende a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial.Se inició hace más de 2 años con un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros.Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le genera y por ser la única en la zona .Antes de empezar con su negocio, tenía los deseos de ser una persona productiva y generar sus propios ingresos para no depender completamente de su pareja y apoyarlos con los gastos de su hogar, además de poder estar en casa y atender a sus hijos menores.Este será el préstamo número 05 con Kiva y está contenta de saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero necesario para concretar sus planes , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 300 nuevos soles comprará golosinas para su negocio tales como galletas , caramelos , chicles , entre otros .
texts.en:
Julia, 38 years old, is married to Israel who works in transportation. He is the father of her 5 children whom she loves very much. They live comfortably  together in their own home.

Julia sells different kinds of various flavored candy in the morning and she put a table in front of her home where she attends to her customers in a friendly and cordial manner. She began more than 2 years ago with her own capital from her savings. She considers her business very profitable because of the profit it generates and because she is the only one in the area.

Before she began her business, she had the desire to be a productive person and earn her own income and not to depend completely on her husband and to help provide for the household expenses. She also wanted to be at home and care for her young children.

This will be her 5th loan cycle with Kiva and she is happy knowing that she can continue counting on the necessary financial support to accomplish her plans, and she agrees to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 300 soles she will buy sweets for her business such as cookies, caramels, gum, and more.

loans.use: to buy sweets such as cookies, caramels, gum, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones, Actualmente vive junto a su madre y su hermana, es muy trabajador, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y fríjol. El cliente  desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía que es donde siembra. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: This client is a responsible man who fulfills his obligations. He is currently living with his mother and sister, he is a hard worker, and he works in agriculture, planting corn and beans. This client wants to increase their sales and this is why he is asking for a credit that will allow him to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, among other things, and to improve the terrain shown in the photograph where he does his planting. He hopes to be able to count on the help this credit represents because he has no other financial resources and this credit will help him to continue helping with household expenses without worrying about exceeding his financial limits.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Bayanmunkh

texts.en: Bayanmunkh, 44 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own small house on a plot of land. All three of his children go to high school. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for five years and during the summertime he also works at a construction site under contract with a building company. His wife grows and sells vegetables in her greenhouse. The greenhouse they used over the years has deteriorated due to its wooden construction. So, he is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to purchase iron plates in order to build an iron greenhouse on his land. As a result, their greenhouse will serve its purpose for many years and they can continue to grow vegetables without worrying. Growing vegetables is good for environment because plants convert carbon dioxide into oxygen. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse made of iron

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. For the past two years, she has operated a utensil and canvas rental business for weddings. She hires from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation to her customers.

Saumu is requesting a loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase more canvas and utensils for hiring to satisfy her clients. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more canvas and utensils

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is 41 years old and married with one child. He sells trousers and has been in the business for the past six years. With the loan, he is planning to buy more trousers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Feliciano De Jesus

texts.es: Feliciano, es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, El trabaja muy duro tiene su propio corral donde cría pollos de engorde; pero aparte de eso se dedica a la siembra de yuca todos los años,  sus productos son de muy buena calidad comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia.  Feliciano solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para pollo, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Feliciano is very friendly and hardworking. He lives with his wife and four children.

He works very hard. He has his own pen where he raises chickens for fattening, but apart from this he also cultivates yuca every year. His products are of very high quality and he sells in the various markets located near his home.

Feliciano is asking for a loan from Integral in order to have the necessary money to invest in the purchase of vitamins and chicken feed. He is eager to increase his sales in order to be able to earn higher profits and give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and chicken feed.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is from Kisauni. She is married to a businessman and they have three children, who attend school, who are the couple's reason to struggle for success.

Patience has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the town market. She occupies two stands. She has a fixed customer base, good income, and good business and personal references. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent client.

She is asking for this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables to stock her store with products to be able to continue giving her customers the quality they expect from her.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to stock her store with products

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada  y su esposo tiene 35 años de edad, disfruta de dos hijos,  los cuales tienen edades  de 3 y 5 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas  y granos básicos, el oficio lo aprendió con su madre y lleva tres años de realizarlo.
