Recently, he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and an additional variety of vegetables to raise. He hopes that with his farming, he will be able to renovate their house and generate more income to support their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and an additional variety of vegetables to raise.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is married and has been blessed with four school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Sera operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge high cost of transportation in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu lives in her house in the Kwale District, and is married. She has had a retail shop since 2003. Her husband and children help her in her retail shop. The loan that she is requesting is to purchase noodles, rice, sugar, and other foods for her retail shop.

She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person, who with time and effort wants to move forward and be a great micro-entrepreneur. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving, and the loan will be of much help.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, rice, sugar, and other foods for her retail shop.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is from Samburu and has a fruits and vegetables business. She sells from her home and also around Samburu.

Luvuno says that she has been able to help her family through her business and that she has given them all that they need to continue having a dignified life, with no deprivations. 

Luvuno wants to be able to continue working and helping her family, so she is asking for this loan to invest in fruits and vegetables, to continue working and offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to invest in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sylevestre

texts.en:
Sylevestre is a 28-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Sylevestre started selling lights in October 2012, and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife, and children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Nyalu

texts.en:
Nyalu is 50 years old; she is married and she has no children. She comes from village of Samburu, and she has been running a workshop at the market for 10 years, selling twigs for use in roofing houses.

Nyalu has a great desire to progress and get ahead in life. She is a very hardworking and resourceful woman, and she says the she offers her supplies everywhere in town, in particular to schools and private buildings.

She is requesting a loan to buy twigs and other supplies so she can satisfy her customers’ requests. She is grateful for the chance she has been given as this will be of great help for her.

loans.use: to buy twigs and other supplies.

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
Artush is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the village of David-Bek which is in Kapan area. Both David’s daughters are students of the State Armenian Pedagogical University.  Artush graduated from Kapan Technical College as a decorator-designer. Now Artush works in Kapan electrical station. His wife is a nurse and works in Kapan hospital.

Since 2000, Artush has been engaged in an agricultural business. He has built a large barn for animals and breeds cows and piglets. His wife helps him in their farm and as Artush said without his wife’s help he couldn't overcome all the difficulties of an agricultural business. Artush is a very worthy farmer and he cares about his animals with big pleasure and also carefully. The meat from his breeding Artush sells to re-sellers from his house and the vegetables which he grows he sells in Kapan fruit markets. 

Artush decided to enlarge his animal breeding and for this he is asking for a loan from Kiva to buy five young calves. He hopes to receive a good profit from this deal.

loans.use: To buy five young calves.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 36 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Along with her husband and three children who are between the ages of 13 and two, she has been selling fufu for the past 16 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fufu for her business. She hopes to be an owner of a house and take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fufu for her business.

loans.name: Christian Cesar

texts.es:
Christian es un joven de carácter muy alegre y sobre todo dispuesto a enfrentar las adversidades para poder salir adelante y poder apoyar a su familia. Christian vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, se desarrolla la agricultura y por tener lugares turísticos hermosos. Christian ha atravesado por momentos difíciles, pero ello no acabo con sus sueño e ilusiones , por ello con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Odontología, asimismo para poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una pequeña clínica odontológica, Christian cree que está saliendo adelante porque le gusta su carrera y sobre todo porque quiere ser un orgullo para su familia.

Christian está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá pagar los gastos de matrícula de su universidad, asimismo comprar materiales de consultorio ya que esta por iniciar su internado y necesita materiales quirúrgicos para desempeñar su labor; de esta manera Christian podrá estudiar en mejores condiciones y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su título profesional e iniciar su clínica odontológica”.
texts.en:
Christian is a happy young man and above all ready to face adversity in order to get ahead and be able to support his family. He lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm climate, agriculture, and its beautiful tourist spots.

Christian has been through difficult times, but this has not stopped his hopes and dreams. With hard work and dedication he is studying a dentistry career, while working in a small dental clinic in order to pay expenses for his studies. He believes that he is getting ahead because he likes his career and above all he wants his family to be proud of him.

Christian is very grateful to Kiva lenders, as thanks to the support they have given him he can pay university fees while buying office materials in order to begin his internship with the necessary surgical supplies to do his work. In this way he will be able to study in better conditions and continue fighting to reach his greatest dream: “to have his professional title and begin his dental practice.”

loans.use: to pay tuition for his dental studies and to buy supplies for his internship

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 48, is married and has six children who always help her out. Janet has been a merchant for three years. She has a well-stocked retail shop with all of the basic goods in well-populated area in town. She says that she began with a small kiosk when she moved to town, and with a lot of sacrifice she grew her business. There is a lot of competition in the area. She also says that she is very proud of her work because with her efforts she has been able to support and educate her children. 

Janet is asking for a loan to buy rice, noodles, beef, drinks and other items so that she can continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, beef, drinks and other items so that she can continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 29-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is married and has three children, between 17 and one.  Two are currently attending school and they all live at home. She completed 4th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Josephine has a table business where she sells blouses and slippers; she has had it for the past ten years. She works from 7AM to 6PM each day in her business. Her greatest challenge in business is less income. She intends to use the loan to buy more inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day to own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Anastanzia

texts.en:
Anastanzia is married; her husband works as a driver. She has a small store, and also sells household consumables in a shop. She is hardworking, responsible, and honest. 

Previously she worked as a salesperson in a supermarket in Samburu. Her dream was to have a small store and sell drinks. Now she has her own store, with a variety of items. She works there everyday from very early in the morning. 

Anastanzia is asking for this loan in order to expand a part of her store. By doing so, she will be able to show her customers a greater variety of items and continue to grow her business. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has received, as it has been a great help.

loans.use: to expand her store, purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Manga

texts.en:
Manga makes a living cooking and selling delicious food, and thanks to her previous Kiva loan, she has been able to continue with her business. She is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business and supporting her family.

Thanks to her previous loan, Manga has expanded and improved her overall business as well as the quality of her products. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase flour, starch, yeast, eggs, and other ingredients for making her delicious food. 

She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase flour, starch, yeast, eggs, and other ingredients for making her delicious food.

loans.name: Adriana Celene

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer joven de 18 años, recibió apoyo de su familia para llegar al quinto año de bachillerato cuando su mayor anhelo era terminar la secundaria, por lo que empezó a trabajar para poder pagarse los estudios con sus propios recursos, y así en poco tiempo poder obtener su bachillerato internacional para el cual está estudiando sin darse por vencida ante las adversidades, pues muchas veces se juega su propia seguridad al trasladarse al centro de la ciudad buscando un centro de cómputo para realizar sus tareas. Adriana vive en una parroquia alejada del pueblo de Salcedo ubicado en la parte Oriente de Cotopaxi una de las provincias más importantes de la Sierra ecuatoriana. En Salcedo existen varios atractivos turísticos como lagunas y balnearios que ofrecen deportes extremos para sus turistas aventureros, sin embargo la principal actividad que desarrollan en este pueblo es la agricultura y en menor cuantía la ganadería. A pesar de estas actividades productivas, hay índices muy preocupantes de analfabetismo y de pobreza por necesidades básicas insatisfechas como por ejemplo el servicio de alcantarillado que solo lo tienen el 25% de los hogares. 
La hermana de Adriana es costurera titulada y le enseñó a Adriana la actividad de arreglar y confeccionar ropa casual. Adriana realiza varios arreglos en el día, pues dedica en la semana 2 horas para terminar trabajos pendientes y los domingos pasa 12 horas en su máquina para dejar todos los trabajos pendientes listos. En temporada de vacaciones ella trabaja más días en la semana, mejorando así sus ingresos. Esta jovencita emprendedora y luchadora solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra de un computador para así poder tener en su casa acceso a la tecnología para realizar sus tareas y de este modo ahorrar en trasporte, impresiones y alquiler que pagaba en los diferentes centros de cómputo. Además estará más segura en casa y el tiempo que le tomaba en transportarse, ella lo podrá invertir en realizar más trabajos de costura.
Adriana agradece a Fundación Alternativa por creer en ella y en sus sueños, pues si no le abrían las puertas, ella no tenía la oportunidad de conseguir financiamiento para su computador y también agradece a los inversionistas que a través de Kiva le ayudarán aun sin conocerla, esto es muy valioso para ella.
texts.en: Adriana is a very young woman, 18 years old. Her greatest wish is to graduate high school, and she is proud to say she has had her family's full support until now. Nevertheless, she started to work in order to pay for her studies out of her own pocket, in order to finish the last year of high school and obtain the international diploma she has studied for. She refuses to admit defeat in the face of adversity, which is why, at great personal risk, she travels to the centre of the city to do her homework on a computer in a cybercafé. Adriana lives in a remote village called Salcedo, located in Oriente de Cotopaxi Province, one of the most important provinces in the Ecuadorian mountains. This village attracts tourists with its lagoons and other bodies of water, suited for tourists looking for a thrill and extreme sports. However, agriculture, followed by animal husbandry, are still the main economic resources of the village. Despite the presence of a functioning economy, it is a very poor village, with worrying statistics of illiteracy and poverty, because many basic necessities are unevenly distributed. For instance, only 25% of homes are connected to the sewer system. Adriana's sister is a certified seamstress, and she taught Adriana how to mend as well as how to make casual clothes. Adriana does many such mendings in a day, since she works at her sewing machine two hours a day and twelve on Sundays. During school holidays, she works a bit more during the week, in order to increase her income. This enterprising and brave young woman asks for a loan that she will use to buy a computer, so as to have access in her own home to the technology she needs to complete her school assignments. This way, she will be able to save money on transportation and on cybercafé and printing fees. Moreover, she is safer at home, and she plans to devote the time she spent commuting to sewing more. Adriana thanks field partner Fundación Alternativa for believing in her and in her dreams, for without the field partner, she would not have been able to finance her purchase. She also thanks Kiva lenders, who help her event though they have never met her, a feat of generosity she treasures.

loans.use: to buy a computer and graduate high school.

loans.name: Gladis Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gladis de 42 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, llena de deseos de progresar y brindarle a sus tres hijos mejores oportunidades de vida. Desde hace nueve años se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas en un carro de perro que ubica a las afueras de su casa, de esta manera ha sacado su familia adelante. Uno de sus  más grandes sueños e acondicionar un local para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, pero tiene claro que este será un sueño a mediano plazo.
En la actualidad tiene una gran dificultad económica, debido que su carro se encuentra en mal estado, por lo cual ha recurrido a la solicitud de un crédito con el fin de realizar los arreglos e invertir en la compra de surtido.
texts.en:
Gladis, 42 years old, is an enterprising woman, full of desire to progress and give her three children better life opportunities.

She has been working nine years in fast food sales from a food cart located outside her home, and this is the way she is supporting the family.

One of her biggest dreams is to outfit a facility to offer better service to her customers, but it is clear that this will be a medium-term dream.

Currently she has great financial difficulties, because her food cart is in bad state, which is why she has asked for a loan with the idea of making repairs and investing in the purchase of supplies.

loans.use: to make repairs to her food cart and to buy household items

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is getting ahead and making an effort to grow. She says that she has good experience in this area because she has been doing this for over three years. She also says that the previous Kiva loan allowed her to make many improvements and continue to grow. Everline’s goal is to continue expanding her business.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as charcoal, fruits, drinks, vegetables, and other things for her store so she can continue her sales. She is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as meats, fruits, drinks, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en:
Novelita is from Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and single. To make a living, she manages a business buying and selling fish. She has been in her business for four years and earns PHP 4,000 a month from these activities. 

Recently, she has requested an amount of PHP 10,000 which will be used to buy additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman and has two children both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a fish selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors. 

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and fire wood. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business growth.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and fire wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural produce.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is getting ahead and makes an effort to grow her business. She says that she has good experience in this area because she has been doing this for a long time. She also says that the previous Kiva loan allowed her to make many improvements and continue to grow. Saumu’s goal is to continue expanding her business.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as meat, fruit, drinks, vegetables, and other things for her store so she can continue her sales. She is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as meat, fruit, drinks, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has been blessed with two children who go to school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

For the past twenty years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 43-year-old man from Ngororero District in the Western Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Boniface started selling lights in November, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Farnadi, and their four children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Please meet 27-year old Finda from Buchanan.  Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County, and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish; many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Finda is collage student, and is married.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman; her spouse is a Firestone rubber buyer.  She has one child age eight, who is in school and lives at home. 

Finda has a  shop that sells cold water and soft drinks.  She has been in business for seven years, and works  five hours every day. 

With this loan, she will buy an inventory for her store.  One of the greatest challenges she faces is increasing her sales.  

She transports her goods by taxi, and she started her business with money from her husband.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. 

Her future plan is to complete her studies.  She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to buy an inventory of soft drinks and cold water to sell.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Please meet 40 year old Ida from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

She completed 10th grade and is married. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her spouse works with Firestone as security. She has five children between 17 and 8, who are in school and live at home.

Ida has a shop which sells cold water and soft drinks. She has been in business for 10 years and works 10 hours per day. With this loan, she will buy more inventory. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to own a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and a father of a single child. Kassem works hard to provide the family income while his wife takes care of their children.

Kassem owns a small shop where he sells cements which are used for construction purposes. He has been in this field since 1990 and has gained good experience. Now, Kassem has 3 employees and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Kassem is requesting a loan of $2,000. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventory to sell. Kassem believes that this loan will positively effect the growth of his business and the increase in profits, and will give him the ability to provide the best for his child.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is getting ahead and makes an effort to grow. She says that she has good experience in this area because she has been doing this for a long time. She also says that the previous Kiva loan allowed her to make many improvements and continue to grow. Riziki’s goal is to continue expanding her business.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise, such as cosmetics, for her store so she can continue her sales. She is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as cosmetics, for her store

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel a sus 25 años de edad, sueña con crear su propio negocio y laborar como independiente, comercializará licor y bebidas. Con el fin de materializar su proyecto, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en acondicionar el local, adquirir los permisos y las licencias correspondientes para abrir al público. 
Asegura que dentro del mercado local ya existe un negocio con las mismas características, pero los precios son bastante elevados, por lo cual aprovechará este factor para crecer dentro del mercado y fidelizar sus clientes. 
Sueña con brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida velando por su bienestar y educación.
texts.en: Daniel, at twenty-five years of age, dreams of having his own shop and being his own boss. His plan is to sell alcohol and other drinks. In order to make this project come to fruition, he asks for a loan to fit out his locale and acquire the necessary permits and licences to open shop. He says that, even though there is already a similar shop in the neighbourhood, its prices are rather steep. Daniel wants to take advantage of that to position himself as the cheaper alternative at first and thus grow and attract a loyal customer base. His dream is to give his son a better standard of living, to protect his well-being and to ensure his education.

loans.use: to fit out his locale and acquire the necessary permits and licences.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu lives in Samburu, Mombasa. She is married and has three children. She is the owner of a well-stocked general store, which she has had for over three years. It is worth noting that she works with her whole family, and it is going very well. Thanks to this business and the work of the entire family, they have been able to grow considerably and are continuing to grow. They want to be able to expand their shop until they have a large supermarket where they might offer a greater variety to their customers.

Saumu is seeking this loan to purchase drinks, wheat flour, vegetables, fruits, maize flour and other products in order to be able to keep providing a good variety to her customers since that is what draws them the most.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, wheat flour, vegetables, fruits, maize flour and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is a married woman with three children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They rent a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons and competition from other clothing sellers. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 53 years old, married and has 6 children. Ali is the sole provider for the family.

Ali owns a general store. He sells all the basic electrical needs of a house. He established his business in 2009 and has gained good experience in this field. Ali is well-known in the neighborhood.

Ali is requesting a loan of $2,100 to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventory. Ali is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may supply the needs of his family and cover his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Bihija

texts.en: Bihija is a hardworking person. This is her second loan with Kiva. She used the previous loan to purchase bales of clothes, and this enabled her to serve her customers and also fill orders that she had. She says that she wants to continue working because this is the only way she can help her family and provide them with what they need to continue growing. She is requesting this loan to purchase clothes for resale, which will enable her to improve her stock of products and continue meeting customer demand. She is grateful for this new assistance that she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Fouras

texts.en:
Fouras is a youth client from Iraq. He is 27 years old and lives with his family consisting of 6 members. Fouras and 2 of his family members provide the family income together.

Fouras owns a blacksmith's shop. He specializes in making doors and windows. He has gained his experience through previously working with his uncle, who also owns a blacksmith's shop. After gaining enough experience in this field, in 2009 Fouras established his own business and now he has 2 employees. Fouras gained good fame in the area.

Fouras is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to pay the annual rent of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may take a better care of his parents.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is an Iraqi youth client who is 21 years old and lives with his family of six members. Ahmad and his parents provide the family income while his four brothers continue their education.
Ahmad is a carpenter who specializes in making bedrooms and living rooms. He began working in this field in 2004. Ahmad has gained good experience in this field and thanks to his clean work, he has become well known in the community.
Ahmad is requesting a youth loan of 1,500 USD. He will use this loan to buy a motor generator in order to increase his production. Ahmad aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may take a better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Maitta from Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County and located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
Maitta did not go to school and is married. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her spouse works as a security man. They have four children, ages 14 to 27, with two in school and living at home. 
Miatta has a shop which sells lappa (traditional fabric clothing). She has been in business for 20 years and works from Monday to Saturday spending 10 hours per day. With this loan, she will buy inventory. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is to increase her sales. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is an Iraqi client, who is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He is the sole provider of the family. 

Hussain owns a blacksmith shop and he specializes in making doors and windows. He established his business in 2009. Hussain has gained good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Hussain is requesting a loan of USD 3,000. The aim of this loan is to buy a piece of equipment, specialized for his work. Hussain is aiming to continue to grow his business, so that he may take better care of his family and provide his children with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a piece of equipment, specialized for his blacksmith shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John a married man, age 32, with two children who are both in school.

John is a businessman who operates a retail shop at Kamuli Trading Center. He says he works seven days a week. He also has rentals in Kamuli, which is also a source of income for his family. He started this business in 2007 and he says it has been prosperous.

John says that the reason why he started this business is to take care of the needs his family and he acquired this loan to obtain a piece of land on which he will construct his residential house.

He says that his main clients are from different areas surrounding Kamuli and the community in which he stays. He faces a challenge of bad debtors and describes himself as a hard-working and resilient man.

loans.use: to obtain a piece of land on which to construct his residential house.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is a 43-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Evariste started selling lights in May, 2012 and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has seven children. Hussain and four of his children together provide the income of the family.

Hussain owns a small shop and specializes in selling all types of Middle Eastern pastries. In 2006, after gaining all the needed experience through working at his friend’s shop, Hussain established his own business and now he has a hired employee. 

Hussain is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD in order to buy a medium-sized motor generator. Hussain is a hard-working person. He will use this motor to work overnight to provide more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a medium-sized motor generator.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia, tiene 40 años de edad y es madre de dos hijos de 13 y 7 años. Aprendió el oficio de la confección gracias a una amiga que le brindó la oportunidad de laborar en su taller. Hoy sueña con convertirse en microempresaria y crear su propio negocio con el fin de mejorar su condición económica y garantizarles a sus hijos una calidad de vida digna. Razón por la que se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina fileteadora e inicar con su proyecto de negocio.
Sueña con tener un gran taller, capacitar y brindarles el ingreso laboral a las madres cabeza de familia.
texts.en: Claudia is 40 years old and has two children, aged 13 and 7. She learned to be a seamstress thanks to a friend, who hired her to work at her workshop. She now dreams to become a small entrepreneur herself, for having her own business would help her improve her economic situation and give her children the means to live with dignity. Thus, Claudia asks for a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine in order to start her business. Her dream is to have a big workshop where she could teach single mothers to sew and then employ them as seamstresses so that they can earn money thanks to their work.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocio tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la cálida ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual posee paisajes hermosos, una gastronomía variada y sobre todo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y sobre todo amables. Rocio debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración de empresas. 

Día a día Rocio trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo, Rocio cree que está saliendo adelante porque a pesar de las adversidades sigue esforzándose con mucho entusiasmo.

Rocio está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina a gas, ya que actualmente su cocina es de kerosene, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y podrá evitar accidentes, así ella seguirá luchando cada día por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa distribuidora”.
texts.en:
Rocio is 35 years old and lives in the warm city of Pucallpa with its beautiful landscapes, its rich cuisine and, above all, its very friendly, kind inhabitants.  Owing to limited financial resources, Rocio was only able to study up to the fifth year of her secondary education.  However, she would have liked to have gone on to study for a degree in business management.

Every day Rocio works in her small business selling candies and sodas.  She works around 9 hours a day as her hard work enables her to cover her household expenses. Rocio believes that she is making progress because, in spite of the difficulties she faces, she continues working hard and with a lot of enthusiasm.

Rocio is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a gas oven (her current oven runs on kerosene).  This will enable her to improve her quality of life and avoid accidents.  She will continue working hard every day to make her biggest dream come true: "to have a wholesale business".

loans.use: to buy a gas oven

loans.name: Varuzhan

texts.en:
Varuzhan is a builder who graduated from State Kapan Civil Engineering College. He is 48 years old and lives with his wife, two sons and daughter in Kapan city. Varuzhan is the bread winner of his family, so he has to work hard day and night in order to support his family. 
For a long time, Varuzhan with his family have been engaged in farming and land cultivating. On his plot of land Varuzhan grows beans, cucumber, parsley, radishes and onions. The agricultural products Varuzhan grows are sold at Kapan food markets. 
Varuzhan asks for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy seed, fertilizer and seedlings for his garden. He hopes to receive a large harvest in this season.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and seedlings for his garden

loans.name: Mwainasha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married and has three school-going children with one still under age. They live in a rental house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a business selling leso (women's wrap cloth) selling from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby who are her customers. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of lesos for resale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 33-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Jean started selling lights in July, 2012 and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will improve his adobe brick home where he lives with his wife Epiphania  and his four children (Claudette, Alice, Kevin, and Kevine).

loans.use: To buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a 37-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is married and has seven children, between 21 and 5. Three are currently attending school and live at home. She has completed 6th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Helena has had a table business for seven years where she sells rice, pepper, vita, etc. She works from 7AM to 6PM each day in her business. Her greatest challenge in business is less income. She intends to use the loan to buy more inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day to own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advanced for their help.

loans.use: to use the loan to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now he lives in Absheron region, with his family. Ramil is 35 years old, married, and has two children, a daughter and a son. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. His daughter goes to school and his son goes to college. He wants his son to become a policeman. He started his business nine years ago to sell chicks and chickens. 

Now Ramil needs a 2,000 AZN loan to buy chickens, to lay eggs and have chicks for resale. He wants to use the money for the future of his children. In the future, Ramil wants to have different poultry for resale. This will be more profitable for his business. Ramil is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a married mother of five children who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mashava Kupfumaishungu Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 38 year old Molly from Masvingo. She is married with four children, two attending school. Molly runs an agriculture business selling chickens. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are loss of chickens through theft and of debtors failing to pay on time. 

Molly has requested a loan of $500 to buy stock feed and more chicks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to have extra disposable income, hence improve family welfare. In the future Molly plans to open a grocery shop and a flea market.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
Jimmy es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa y juntos tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, a quien adora y ama muchísimo ya que desde que nació se ha convertido en lo más importante para él y sobre todo que es su fuente de motivación para salir adelante.  Debido a los pocos recursos económicos Jimmy solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil.

Día a día Jimmy trabaja como ayudante de albañil, el trabaja día a día en obras de construcción y puede laborar alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar; Jimmy cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Jimmy esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar los tramites par a poder obtener su título de propiedad de un pequeño terreno que luego de mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar, de esta manera podrá tener un lugar donde poder construir poco a poco su vivienda y poder ofrecerle a su familia un lugar donde vivir, así Jimmy seguirá luchando y trabajando duro para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y poder tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 22 years old, lives with his wife, and they have a 1 year old son. He adores and loves him very much and since he was born he has become his highest priority and above all is his source of motivation to get ahead.

Due to scarce financial resources Jimmy could only study through the fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to study civil engineering.

Day by day Jimmy works as a mason’s assistant. He works daily in construction and works about 9 hours a day. Through this work and effort he is able to pay the household expenses. Jimmy believes that he is succeeding because he is responsible and above all he is eager to get ahead.

Jimmy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the help that they have provided he can expedite the formalities of obtaining his property title of a small plot of land that after a lot of effort he was able to buy so he could have a place where he can construct little by little his home and be able to offer his family a place to live, as Jimmy continues fighting and working hard to achieve his biggest dream: “To give a good education to his son and be able to have his own business.”

loans.use: to pay for legal procedures to expedite the formalities of obtaining property title to a plot of land

loans.name: Marlón Iván

texts.es:
Marlon tiene 34 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Desde muy temprana edad aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura y la ganadería; fue su padre quien le enseño y en su tiempo libre aprendió de mecánica y estructuras metálicas.  Para comprar los insumos agrícolas debe de viajar a la ciudad; camina treinta minutos a pie y otros  treinta minutos en autobús. Dependiendo de la cantidad de insumos que compre, paga una carreta para que los traslade. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, abono, pesticidas, herbicidas para cultivar granos básicos. De esta manera obtendrá los ingresos para la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Marlon, age 34, is in a relationship and has one child.  He learned to work in agriculture and with livestock at a very early age.  It was his father who taught him.  In his free time he learned mechanics and metallic structures.

In order to buy the agricultural supplies, he needs to travel to the city.  He walks 30 minutes and spends another 30 minutes on the bus.  Depending on the amount of supplies that he buys, he pays for a truck to transport them.

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy fertilizers, compost, pesticides, herbicides, and to cultivate basic grains.  This way he will get the income to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pesticides, herbicides, and to cultivate basic grains.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is a 33-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is married and has four children, between 13 and 3. Three are currently attending school and they all live at home. She completed 9th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as hard-working woman.

She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Musu has a table business which sells rice,oil, pepper, etc for the past 12 years. She works from 7AM to 6PM per day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is less income. She intends to use the loan to buy more inventory. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day to own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advanced for their help.

loans.use: to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is getting ahead and making an effort to grow. She says that she has good experience in this area because she has been doing this for a long time. She also says that the previous Kiva loan allowed her to make many improvements and continue to grow. Pili’s goal is to continue expanding her business.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as meats, fruits, drinks, vegetables, and other things for her store so she can continue her sales. She is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as meats, fruits, drinks, vegetables, and other things

loans.name: Felicia's Group

texts.en:
Felicia, Margaret, Aku, and Diana are the members in this group. They sell rice, yams, plantains, vegetables, sandals, ready-made dresses, and second-hand clothing. They reside in the Teshie community. They have been together from January 2010 to the present.

Aku is 44 years old and lives Accra North Area, Ghana. She travels to market to purchase sandals, ready-made dresses and she sells them to customers. She is married to Bismark who is a draughtsman and has two children between the ages of 16 and 20 years old, both of whom attend school. 

Aku has been doing this business for 12 years, a business she started with money given to her by her husband. She learned this way of selling from her friends. 

Aku is requesting a loan to purchase more sandals, shoes, and ready-made materials to sell to customers. Her future plan is to educate all of her children.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 3,500 to buy enough goods to sell to customers.

loans.use: to purchase more sandals, shoes, and ready-made materials to sell to customers.

loans.name: Simeon Nestor

texts.es:
Simeon es un hombre muy trabajador, a sus 63 años de edad, mantiene la vitalidad y la alegría de un joven de 20, Simeon vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad de clima cálido, atractivos turísticos maravillosos y sus pobladores son personas alegres y carismáticas. Simeon comparte su vida junto a su esposa, quien lo anima en todo lo que el hace y sobre todo es su amiga y su mejor compañera.

Cada día Simeon trabaja como agricultor, el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas al día ya que con ello solventa los gastos de su hogar, Simeon cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo le gusta lo que hace.

Simeon agradece a los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le estan brindando el podrá mejorar las paredes de su vivienda, ya que actualmente se encuentran rajadas y de esta  manera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, de esta manera el podrá seguir luchando para podrá hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Reunir a sus hijos que se encuentra lejos de la ciudad”.
texts.en:
Simeon is a very hard-working man.  At his 63 years of age he keeps the vitality and joy of a 20 year old young man.  Simeon lives in the city of Nazca, a warm city with marvelous tourist attractions.  Its people are happy and charismatic.  Simeon shares his life together with his wife, who supports him in everything that he does.  Above all, she is his friend and his best companion.

Each day Simeon works as a farmer.  He devotes around eight hours a day to his work.  He does this because it pays the household expenses.  Simeon believes that he is getting ahead because he is responsible, and above all, he likes what he does.

Simeon is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the support they are giving him he will be able to improve the walls of his house.  They are currently cracked, and this way he will be able to have a better quality of life for his family.  This way he will be able to continue struggling in order to be able to make his biggest dream come true:  “To reunite his children who are far away from the city”.

loans.use: to improve the walls.

loans.name: Luz Mirian

texts.es:
Luz tiene 40 años de edad, y es madre cabeza de familia de tres hijos. Laboró por varios años en el sector de la confección, conocimientos y habilidades que trasladará a la creación de su propio negocio. Con el fin de iniciar con su proyecto productivo, Luz se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina de coser y dedicarse a trabajar desde su hogar en la confección de prendas de vestir.
Sueña con tener una buena aceptación en el mercado local y generar los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 40 years old and is the female head of a family of three children. She has been working for some years in the garment sector, gaining knowledge and craftsmanship in order to create her own business.

With the purpose of beginning her own production project, Luz is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine so she can work from home making clothing to wear.

She dreams of having a good reception in the local market and earning enough to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Jose Alvaro

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia. El se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos como una fuente financiera para obtener ingresos, lo aprendio de su familia. El prestamo que solicita  le permitirá comprar los insumos agricolas necesarios para llevar a cabo el cultivo tales como: abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros; este le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y lograr una buena cosecha.
Su sueño es obtener mayores utilidades y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his family. His source of income comes from growing basic grains, an activity he learned from his family.
This loan will allow him to buy farming supplies for his crops such as fertilizer, herbicide, fungicide, insecticide, pesticide, etc. This will help him increase his income and will allow him to have a good harvest.
His dream is to increase his profit and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide, fungicide, insecticide, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Jhan Carlos

texts.es:
Jhan es un joven de 21 años muy alegre y entusiasta, que vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Jhan solo ´pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de agronomía.

Día a día Jhan trabaja como obrero en un fundo la ciudad, con lo cual apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar ya que ellos también trabaja en un fundo y sus ingresos son pocos, Jhan cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. 

Jhan está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá comprar una cocina a gas ya en su vivienda solo cocinan a leña y de esta manera podrá apoyar a sus padres en mejorar su calidad de vida y evitar accidentes, así el seguirá trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de Agronomía”.
texts.en:
Jhan is a young 21 year old who is very happy and enthusiastic.  He lives in the district of Parcona in Ica, Perú.  Due to his limited economic means, Jhan has only been able to study through the 5th grade, but he would have liked to go on to study agronomy.  

Day after day Jhan works as a manual laborer on a farm close to the city.  With this job he helps his parents with household expenses since they also work on a farm and their income is limited.  Jhan believes that he is doing well because he is very kind and above all because he has a great desire to get ahead.

Jhan is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to their great help he will be able to purchase a gas stove since in his home they only cook over firewood and in this way he will be able to help his parents improve their quality of life and avoid accidents.  Thus he will continue working and struggling in order to make his great dream a reality: "To study the field of Agronomy."

loans.use: To purchase a gas stove.

loans.name: Benoitte

texts.en:
Benoitte is seeking a top-up loan of RWF 30,000  to purchase 10 additional rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Benoitte started selling lights in February, 2012 and she has sold 50 lights to date, providing clean energy to 250 people. She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Kaed

texts.en:
Kaed is a married Iraqi client, who is 33 years old and has two children.

Kaed is a mechanic. He specializes in changing engine filters and fixing electrical problems of a car. Kaed established his business in 2006 and has gained his experience through previously working a several garages as an employee until he established his own business. Kaed now has an employee hired and has been growing with fame and respect thanks to his competitive prices.

Kaed is requesting a loan of 2,700 USD. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter and a sunshade for his garage. Kaed is aiming to keep growing in his business so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter and a sunshade for his garage.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 31 year old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Gabriel started selling lights in September, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife .

loans.use: To buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a hardworking person. This is her second loan with Kiva. She used the previous loan to purchase a fridge for her fruit juice business, and this enabled her to serve her customers and also fill orders that she had. She says that she wants to continue working because this is the only way she can help her family and provide them with what they need to continue growing. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase bales of hand bags and shoes to boost her business, which will enable her to improve her stock of products and continue meeting customer demand. She is grateful for this new assistance that she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase bales of hand bags and shoes to boost her business.

loans.name: Rangariranai Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 36-year-old Tambudzai from Masvingo. She is married with two children, one attending school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Tambudzai runs a retail business selling clothes and household property from a rented premises. The business has been in operation for 6 years. She says the main challenge she faces is the low demand for clothes. 

Tambudzai has requested a loan of $600 to buy a refrigerator for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her increase her income hence improve family welfare. In the future Tambudzai plans to own a shop.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for resale
